Juana is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to make improvements to her house. There has been a great deal of rain within the past few months, so these improvements will make her quality of life better. Juana continues to work so that she can fulfill her greatest wish of moving her family forward.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 24 years old and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling fresh foods, specifically bananas, plus selling fire wood to supplement her income. This business has helped her to provide food for her family and also earn income to meet other needs. Janet has a dream of educating her children and eradicating poverty from her home, despite being challenged by seasonal changes and high transport costs to transport the bananas to the market. She is acquiring a loan to buy fresh food like bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh food like bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fungicides to farm naranjilla

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover treatment costs.

loans.name: Tirta

texts.en:
Tirta runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Tirta is single and lives with four persons in the family home.
		
Tirta began working with Ruma six months ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last three months, he has had around $101 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Hermen Favio

texts.es: Hermen, es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, vive en Maldonado, parroquia de Tulcán, vive con sus padres, se dedica al cultivo de naranjilla desde ya 8 años atrás, es amigable y muy responsable. El necesita el préstamo para comprar fungicidas para seguir cultivando la naranjilla debido a que existen enfermedades que dañan los cultivos. Su sueño es poder tener su casa y un terreno propio para poder seguir cultivando.
texts.en: Hermen, is 26 years old. He is single and he lives in Maldonado, Tulcán parish with his parents. He's been farming naranjilla for 8 years. He is friendly and very responsible. He needs this loan to buy fungicides to continue farming naranjilla as there is a lot of disease that can harm his crops. His dream is to own his own home and some land to continue farming.

loans.use: to buy fungicides to farm naranjilla

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es:
El Gualberto tiene 38 años de edad, está acompañado con la señora Daniela, donde viven en la ciudad de Itá. Su actividad se basa en la venta de frutas y verduras.
Gualberto comenta que actualmente cuenta con plantación de melones y tomates y que tiene un vehículo para hacer el transporte de sus productos. Además de eso también trabaja en hacer servicios de fletes. Esta es una pareja muy trabajadora que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante, y luchan por mejores condiciones de vida para la familia.
El Sr. Gualberto solicita el préstamo, para invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras variadas, para poder surtir su negocio, y de esa forma luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gualberto is 38 years old and is married to Sra. Daniela. They live in the city of Itá. His business involves selling fruits and vegetables.

Gualberto says that he currently has a plot where he plants melons and tomatoes. He also has a vehicle that he uses to transport his products. In addition, he provides cargo transport services. Gualberto is a hardworking client who has made many sacrifices in order to get ahead. He strives to provide better living conditions for his family.

Sr. Gualberto is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of various fruits and vegetables. This will enable him to restock his business, which gives him a way of improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used the previous loan to buy six rolls of barbed wire, poles and pay workers. He succeeded in his business and managed to buy more cattle using the dairy proceeds. For proper balancing,he also needs to expand more on his farm to avoid over crowding of the animals. Being a farmer he faces a challenge of unpredictable weather, especially the dry season that reduces his milk production, hence limiting profit. John has asked for a loan to buy barbed wire, poles and to pay workers.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, poles and to pay workers.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia works hard to support her family. Portia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Portia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Portia has been in this business for 13 years now.

Portia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: George William

texts.en:
George is a 33-year-old married Ugandan man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy sugar and salt for selling. Having two school-going children, he is working hard to ensure that with the earnings from the retail shop, from produce selling, from farming and from a salary as a teacher, he has available fees for his children. He hopes to finish up his residential house, although he is affected by competition from people with similar businesses. 

George intends to use a loan to buy general merchandise like smearing oils, cooking oil and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like smearing oils, cooking oil and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Mpeefu Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Nalis is a 54-year-old married and hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda, with three children, of which two attend school. He has been farming and selling produce since 1998 to generate income to support his family. His dream is buying more land for farming, but he is challenged by inadequate capital and poor roads. 

Nalis is requesting a loan to buy seeds of maize and beans for planting. He is a member of the Mpeefu Tweyambe Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy seeds of maize and beans for planting

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a 30-year-old female who lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. Zaina practices farming, whereby she cultivates maize, beans, cassava and groundnuts on a large scale for selling. Her farm business is located in a rural area. She started the business because it is what she could manage to do. 

Zaina has a great dream of buying a motor vehicle for easy transporting of her produce to her customers; however, she is challenged by weather changes. She intends to use the loan to buy produce such as maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tailoring items like needles, thread and clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Loice Mirirai

texts.en: Greetings from Bulawayo the second largest city in Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Loice. She is married with one child who attends school. Loice runs a retail business selling shoes, clothes and blankets. She also supplies cheese to some supermarkets in town. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenge being faced is stiff competition from other operators in the industry. Loice has requested a loan of $750 to buy blankets, clothes and footwear for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Loice plans to open a fashion boutique shop in town and run a couple of flea markets as well.

loans.use: to buy blankets, clothes and footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Al-Oans Group

texts.en:
Al-Oans is a group of three members. All of them are female, living in Aden, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Anisa is a 59-year-old married woman with four children. She is an uneducated woman, living with her spouse in a very old house. Though both she and her husband work with the government, their salaries hardly cover the expenses of their big family like food, clothes and tutoring fees. Most of the home appliances they have are old and need replacement, but they can't afford to do that; therefore, Anisa decided to help her husband and apply for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB. Anisa looks forward to renovating her house after she successfully repays all the installments.

loans.use: to buy home appliances

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy thanks the Kiva lenders for contributing to his previous loan. With the loan, he is now a proud owner of an expansive area on which he will build his residential house. He is applying for another loan that he will use to buy fertilizers for his tea plantation.

He grows tea for sale and he has done this since 2004; a business he started with a hope of getting enough money as income which he would use to cater for the family needs and pay school fees for the children. In addition to tea growing, Emmanuel also does carpentry; a business that boosts his incomes greatly. He applied for a loan of four million shillings (UGX.4,000,000) for buying fertilizers to apply on the tea garden so that he can harvest much more and hence make higher sales. His clients are mainly tea traders from the same area and the factories which buy the green tea for processing. He is mainly challenged by the rainy season which affects the tea garden negatively but he believes that this will not be a challenge any more if he boosts the fertility of the soils. 

He believes that in the long run he will get enough money to cater for all the needs of his family, especially the educational need for his children so that they can compete favorably for jobs on the job market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: Fiorella de 25 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella es parte del grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” y está conformado por 09 socias entusiastas y responsables. Fiorella es promotora de venta  en un canal televisivo. Fiorella tiene el anhelo de contar con su propio local de golosinas y crecer en su negocio. Es por ello el crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de Golosinas. El grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Fiorella es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo rayado multicolor.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 25 years, is separated, and has two children who depend on her. She is part of the "Unidos Para Triunfar" [United to Triumph] group, which has nine enthusiastic and responsible members. Fiorella is a sales promoter at a televisions station. Fiorella longs to have her own candy store and to grow in her business. This is why she asked for a loan, so she can use it to buy candy. 

The "Unidos Para Triunfar" group thanks all of the Kiva investors for the support provided. Fiorella is the third woman from the right and is wearing a multicolored striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy candy

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: Maria de 58 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella es una mujer muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Maria  desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband. She is a very responsible woman and her main priority is helping her family get ahead. Maria sells tortillas and is in charge of making them every day around noon and in the evenings. Her business is located in her home.

Maria would like greatly to improve her business so that she can have a more stable income for supporting her family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy corn and lime powder in bulk for making tortillas in larger quantities. There is always an increase in demand on the weekends, but many tortilla shops are closed during that time. Therefore, she has an opportunity to generate more income and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder in bulk.

loans.name: Berioska

texts.es:
La socia Berioska se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos,la socia vende todo tipo de zapatos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Berioska is continuing with her business selling shoes.  She sells all types of shoes.  Berioska works from 8am until 6pm, and she already has a number of years of experience with this business, which is going very well.  Her dream is to have her own shoe store. 

Berioska is requesting this loan to buy shoes.  She is happy to be receiving this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members.

She operates a pub on a retail basis at the market. She works for seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACC0 to buy a jerrycan of local brew, spirits, soda, and crates of beer. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality.

Her goal and aspirations are to buy a fridge for her bar and a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her major expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local brew, spirits, soda and crates of beer

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 15 years. Rosemarie earns more income from raising pigs.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheep to increase the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Cher is a 42-year-old lady who lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children in a small village in Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her raised hand is Cher. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. 

Some years ago, Cher formed a group with nine other women from her village with the group name of "Maa Laxmi Self Help Group". All the group members are engaged in different business activities, such as selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc., to alleviate their poverty. Cher is the president of this group. She motivated all the group members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives. 

Cher, along with her group, requested a loan of 150,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family, and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 37 years old and single.  

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000  PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nancy has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items, including: candies, biscuits, snack foods, cooking oil, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rodelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Rodelyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Rodelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida works hard to support her family. Brigida is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Brigida has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Brigida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 33 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Analou works very hard to provide for them.

Analou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, eggs, chocolate drink, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Analou has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Analou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Samaleswari Self Help Group is a group consisting of 15 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start grocery shops where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Ahalya, who was selected as their president. Ahalya is a 28-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children, who are at their schooling. The lady in the picture standing with her hand raised is Ahalya. 

Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near to her village. Ahalya runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan for purchasing items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: use a portion of Khawla's Group's $ 3,000 loan to buy an iron, a table and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Maa Sarala Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Sarala Self Help Group is made up of eleven women from a small village of Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in different activities, such as betel leaf cultivation, milk selling, paddy and vegetable cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women having a willingness to learn new business trends. They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses.

One of the group members, Jayanti, is the president of this group. The lady standing first on the left with her raised hand in the photo is Jayanti. Jayanti is 31 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law and five children. She does betel leaf cultivation. She produces betel leaf and sells it at the market. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband helps Jayanti in betel leaf selling at the market. 

Jayanti is planning to buy standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, so she can produce more betel leaf and can increase her income. Jayanti, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 165,000 INR to invest in their business activities. She will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her betel leaf cultivation. 

She wants to construct a house for her family. She says, on the behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her betel leaf cultivation.

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и является кормилицей 2 детей. Она свет в жизни детей и надежда для них. Барно 8 лет назад она начала свой бизнес купле продажей одежды на местном рынке. Она имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Она в основном продает женскую одежду, так как спрос на женскую одежду больше чем на мужские или детские одежды на местном рынке. Она должна обновить товар на новый сезон и привлечь больше клиентов, так как ей необходимо зарабатывать больше денег для обеспечения своих детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки женской одежды для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Она мечтает, чтобы ее дети были образованными людьми.
texts.en: Barno is an industrious woman. She is married and is nursing two children. The light of her life is her kids and she has hope for them. Eight years ago Barno started her business buying and selling clothing in the market. She has her own trading stall in the local market. She mainly sells women's clothing, as there is greater demand than for men's or children's clothing in the local market. She needs to update her goods for the new season and to attract new customers, as she needs to earn more money for her children. She is requesting the sum of 1000 Somoni to purchase women's clothing for the new season. She is waiting for your kindness and wishes for your mercy. She dreams that her children will be educated people.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothes for new season

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 41-year-old woman from the town of Corella, Bohol. She is married with 6 children. The oldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. Cecilia's husband works in maintenance at a private school to support their family. Cecilia operates a snack food vending business. She sells banana cue (fried banana with caramelized sugar), ice candy and hot cake. Her business started four years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional supplies, such as flour and rice, to continue her livelihood activity of food-vending.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to expand her food vending business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for food-vending, like flour and rice.

loans.name: Wenceslawa

texts.en:
Wenceslawa is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Corella, Bohol. She is married with 2 grown children. Her husband worked as a carpenter to support their family. She engages in food vending business. She sells snack foods like banana cue (fried banana with caramelized sugar), hot cake and puto (steam rice cake). Her business started more than 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks like flour, cooking oil, and other ingredients to cater to the needs of her customers as well as to augment the family's daily needs.

In the future, she hopes to expand her food business and increase profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her food vending business

loans.name: Alejandria

texts.en:
Alejandria is 44 years old and has five children. Alejandria is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Alejandria is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Alejandria requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Alejandria has been raising livestock for 8 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alejandria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Jay Maa Laxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
The women of the Jay Maa Laxmi SHG are from a small village in Odisha, India. The group is composed of ten women who earn their living by raising animals like cattle and chickens, selling milk, and cultivating and selling vegetables. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan with People's Forum. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams. 

Soudamini is a 44-year-old married mother of one child who is in his schooling. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Soudamini. She completed five years of formal education, but due to the poor economic condition of her family, had to leave her education behind. Along with all the clients of People's Forum, Soudamini realizes that education is a vital key to a successful future for her children. 

She shares that her business is running quite well and, because of its success, she will be able to register her child in a good school this year! Her husband shares the same goals for the child. Soudamini is engaged in vegetable cultivation, and she produces potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and seasonal vegetables. 

She is applying for her first loan with People's Forum. The requested funds will be used to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation. On behalf of her colleagues, Soudamini expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support.

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 51 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store

loans.name: Dillia

texts.en:
Dillia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making plastic bags in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years now.


Dillia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.


Dillia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Eleanor works very hard to provide for them.

Eleanor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Eleanor has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, laundry soap, bath soap, vinegar, coffee, cooking oil, etc. 

Eleanor would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Merveille Group

texts.fr: Madame Nsimire  est présidente de l’association d’affaire  Merveille. A 50 ans, elle est mariée à un chômeur  et ensemble ils ont 8 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de la viande de porc depuis 2006. Le nouveau prêt servira à acheter 9 porcs pour l'avancement de son activité. Son vouloir est  d’étendre son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de la soutenir.
texts.en: Mrs Nsimire is the president of the business association Merveille. She is a 50 years old, with an unemployed husband. They have eight children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling pork meat since 2006. She is asking for a new loan in order to purchase 9 more pigs and increase her level of activity, and she hopes to continue to grow her business. She is thankful to Hekima for their support.

loans.use: purchase nine pigs

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo, a 42-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda, used his previous loan to pay school fees for his children. After realizing that farming alone could not meet the day-to-day needs of his family, he decided to venture into the motorcycle transport business. 

High fuel prices and a poor network of roads limit Deo's profits. His dreams are to educate his children to university and buy at least five motorcycles, which he intends to hire out to riders who will be remitting 80% of their daily earnings. 

Deo is now requesting another loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Las Domingueras Group

texts.es:
Berlin es una señora casada de 29 años de edad, vive junto a su hija de ocho años de edad y su esposo en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. Ella se encuentra en la parte derecha, la ultima de la fotografía.
Ella comenta que se dedica al servicio de molino (sirve para moler el maíz cosido para convertirlo en masa). Ahora cuenta con diez años de experiencia, decidió obtar por esta labor ya que en su comunidad no había, hasta la fecha es bastante rentable en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias.
Ahora ella se ha dado cuenta que este negocio es bastante productivo, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de formar un grupo para emprender nuevos negocios que ayuden a las familias de los miembros de su grupo, con la intención de mejorar su economía. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de maíz y utensilios de mantenimiento.
Su sueño es comprar otro molino para que le genere otro ingreso, como también  mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Berlin is a 29-year-old married woman. She lives with her eight-year-old daughter and her husband in the Department of Suchitepequez. She is on the right side of the photograph, the last woman in the line.

She says that she makes a living by providing milling service (this serves to grind cooked corn to turn it into flour). She now has ten years of experience, and decided to do this work because the service didn't exist in her community. So far it's been quite profitable in terms of generating income and earnings.

She has now realized that this business is quite productive, so she has made the decision to form a group to start new businesses that help the families of the group members, with the intention of improving their finances. She will use the loan to buy corn and tools for maintenance.

Her dream is to buy another mill so it can generate more income for her and also improve the service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn and tools for maintenance.

loans.name: Diosnisia Maria

texts.es: La señora Dionisia tiene la edad de 35 años, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, es madre soltera.Desde que era una jovencita de 17 años trabajaba en una empresa manicera donde se deempeñaba como obrera (seleccionando mani) y a la vez estudiaba para terminar su secundaria, posteriormente le llego la oportunidad de trabajar en la Alcaldia de su municipio y sin dudarlo ingreso a laborar en donde se desempeña como conserje desde hace 6 años, en donde se encarga de la limpieza de las areas que tiene asignadas para realizarle la limpieza.Ella nos comentó que los creditos le han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que le han permitido invertirlos en los estudios de la universidad de su hija, la cual esta en tercer año de la carrera de Contabilidad Publica y finanzas. A pesar de sus escasos recursos la señora Dionisia esta luchando para que su hija se prepare en la universidad y sea alguien en la vida. Doña Dionisia es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora, alegre y con deseos de superación y como meta a corto plazo es tener su propia casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Dionisia is a 35-year-old single mother with three children who are in school. At the age of 17, she worked for a peanut company as a laborer (processing peanuts) while she was finishing high school. Afterwards, she was given the opportunity to work for the city and she accepted the job without hesitation. There she worked as a janitor for six years. She was in charge of all the housekeep duties for the areas that she was assigned.

Dionisia says that the loans have been a great help. The money has allowed her to invest in her daughter’s university studies. She is in her third year of studying for a degree in Public Accounting and Finance. Despite having limited resources, Sra. Dionisia is striving to help her daughter prepare herself while at the university so that she can become someone in life.

Doña Dionisia is a determined, enterprising, and cheerful woman who has the drive to succeed. Her short-term goals include having a house of her own and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university expenses (tuition and supplies).

loans.name: Francisco Vladimir

texts.es:
Francisco de 25 años de edad,   estudio segundo grado de educación está  acompañado  su pareja se dedica al comercio informal a la venta de pescado en temporadas cuando en la zona sale bastante, tienen en común 1 hijo el cual esta pequeño no estudia aún.


Francisco se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, al comercio. La actividad que más ha realizado es la agricultura pues su padre le enseño esta actividad desde que estaba muy pequeño pues era la única forma de  ayudarle a su padre.

Además del negocio al que se dedica el cliente es también pescador,  es una actividad económica que tiene adicional que le permite generar un ingreso para ayudar a su familia,   el negocio de la pesca del cliente está de distancia a 7 kilómetros los cuales recorre en bicicleta pues no hay otro medio de transporte donde él vive para llegar hasta ahí.

En el negocio se involucra su compañera de vida,  porque él se encarga de la pesca y ella los vende en la comunidad y en ocasiones en el municipio más cercano, el horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar  una red de pesca artesanal. La cual es una herramienta que hoy día no tiene y esto le vendrá a ayudar a mejorar su trabajo en la pasca a demás pretende comprar una canoa para ya no alquilar cada vez que realiza el trabajo.
El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su trabajo y a tener un mejor ingreso, ya que aprovechara de mejor manera su trabajo.

Los objetivos y sueños del cliente para su negocio,  es cada vez irlos mejorando,  obteniendo las herramientas  necesarias para desempeñarlos. Para su familia sueña con  tenerlos en mejores condiciones de vida un día,  hacer su casa de un mejor material ya que actualmente es de adobe y vive en el terreno de un familiar sueña con comprar un terreno propio para vivir. El préstamo le ayudara a tener sus herramientas de trabajo, lo que le permitirá tener un mejor ingreso y darle a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is twenty-five years old and studied through the second grade.  He is in a relationship and makes a living selling fish during the seasons when there is a lot to catch.  He and his partner have a son, who is still too young to be in school.

Francisco has made a living in trade for four years.  The sector he has been most involved with is agriculture.  His father taught him this type of work when he was very young; this was the only way he was able to help his father when he was younger.

In addition to this work, he also makes a living as a fisherman.  This additional economic activity allows him to generate extra income for his family.  His fisherman business is located seven kilometers away, so he travels by bicycle; there is no other means of transportation where he lives that would get him to work.  His life partner is also involved in this business.  He is in charge of the fishing, and she sells the fish in the community and sometimes also in the nearest municipality.  They work five hours each day.

He is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO in order to buy a fishing net, which he currently does not own.  Having his own fishing net would greatly help him to improve his work as a fisherman.  Buying a canoe would also be helpful, since he would not have to rent one each time that he goes out to fish.  This loan will help him to improve his work and to earn greater profits; he wants to take advantage of his improved means of work.

He has many hopes and dreams for his business.  He always wants to continue improving by getting the necessary tools to continue his work.  He dreams of providing better life conditions for his family, and of rebuilding their home with better material.  Their house is currently made of adobe brick and they live on a relative's land.  He wants to buy his own land.

The loan will help him to acquire his tools for work, allowing him to earn a higher income and to ultimately provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and canoe.

loans.name: Fermín Galileo

texts.es:
Fermín de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de educación, está a acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en ocasiones se dedica al comercio informal. Tienen en común 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad.

Fermín se dedica a la agricultura y también a la ganadería,  se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 13 años. Decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque su grado  académico no le ha permitido obtener un mejor empleo para ayudar a su familia;  el cliente también realiza el trabajo de jornal por lo que es un ingreso adicional en el hogar.

El negocio de él está a tres kilómetros de distancia, las cuales recorre de diferentes formas en ocasiones lo hace en bicicleta. Cuando le toca llevar algún insumo lo hace en carreta halada por una yunta de bueyes y cuando no tiene ninguna de las herramientas lo hace caminado. En el trabajo también le colabora su compañera de vida,  quien cuando él está muy cargado de trabajo le colabora. El horario de trabajo es de 7 horas al día.


El cliente utilizara el préstamo,  para arrendar el terreno donde sembrara los granos básicos como  maíz, frijol y maicillo  para esta temporada;  ya que él no tiene un lugar propio donde sembrar  también utilizara una parte en la compra de una herramienta de trabajo necesaria para el desempeño de su trabajo y es una carreta  de madera la cual utiliza para acercar los granos básicos hasta su casa. 

Los sueños del cliente son ofrecerle a su familia lo mejor que con esfuerzo y dedicación  puede lograrlos.  Sueña con ver a sus hijos estudiar una carrera universitaria,  lo cual él no pudo lograr.

 Para su negocio sueña con tener la oportunidad de cultivar más productos agrícolas como hortalizas verduras entre otras, para tener más ingresos.  El préstamo le ayudara a tener las condiciones necesarias para cultivar y así el próximo año ampliar su negocio cultivando más terreno que el  que actualmente  está sembrando y cultivando otros productos agrícolas así ampliara su negocio.
texts.en:
Fermín is 36 and has a sixth grade education.  He has a wife who does domestic work and occasionally informal trade.  They have two minor children together.

Fermín earns his living in agriculture and livestock.  He's been in business for thirteen years.  He decided to go into this business because his education level hasn't allowed him to get better work to help out his family.  He also does day labor for additional household income.

His business is three kilometers away and he gets there a variety of ways, sometimes by bicycle.  When he needs to haul supplies he does it by ox-cart and when he doesn't he walks.  When he's loaded down with work, his wife helps him.  He has a seven-hour-per-day work schedule.

He'll use his loan to rent a plot of land where he'll plant basic grains like corn, beans, and sorghum for this season because he doesn't have his own space to plant them.  He'll also use part of the loan to buy a wood cart to transport the grains to his house.  

Fermín's dreams include offering his family the best he can provide with his effort and dedication.  He dreams of seeing his children study for a college degree, which he wasn't able to manage for himself.  

For the business, Fermín dreams of having the opportunity to grow more crops like green vegetables, among others, so he can earn more income.  This loan will help him have the conditions necessary for planting, and next year expand the business by cultivating more land than he is now and growing other crops.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land where he'll plant basic grains like corn, beans, and sorghum for this season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase iron, wire, blocks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Diamado

texts.fr:
Agé de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, Diamado vit dans une famille polygame dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Mme Diamado  mène des activités de commerce notamment la vente d’articles divers de boutique depuis plus de 6 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, sa demande est souvent très grande, car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son deuxième prêt  individuel. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition des stocks de  diverses marchandises (thés, sucre, savons, céréales et des produits alimentaires). Elle s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à Koutiala à une clientèle mixte en espèce. Mme compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire aux petites dépenses de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: A 32 year old mother of five children, Diamado lives in a polygamous family in the city of Koutiala (region of Sikasso). For the past six years, she has been selling diverse merchandise from a boutique. This activity bring her enough revenues, and she often has many requests from her numerous clients. In order to continue satisfying her clients and in order to enlarge her business activity, she is asking the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for her second individual loan. She will use this loan in order to stock up on diverse merchandise (teas, sugar, soaps, grains and other food products). She stocks up from wholesalers in Koutiala and sells in her boutique in Koutiala to a mixed client base. She hopes to earn a monthly benefit of 40 000 FCFA, that she will use to reimburse her loan, cover the small family expenses, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase diverse merchandise

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María Alicia tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Oyotún una comunidad acogedora donde se puede encontrar diversos platos típicos de la zona en los restaurants, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodega donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad leche, azúcar, arroz, aceite, su esposo le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Alicia is 51 years old, she lives with her husband and son in the district of Oyotún, a welcoming community where you can find a diversity of local dishes in the restaurants there. The population here works primarily in agriculture, business and livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of the region Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. 
She has a store where she sells a variety of products like milk, sugar, rice, and cooking oil. Her husband helps her at the store. She has asked for a loan in order to purchase a variety of groceries to offer her customers.

loans.use: purchase a variety of groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a solar power system for his home.

loans.name: Habimana's Group

texts.fr: La cliente Buralike est une brave commerçante et membre  d’un collectif  d’affaires «Bienheureuse », senior  entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans, marié  et mère de 4 enfants  qui tous étudient. La cliente est  une vendeuse des divers habillements. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un magasin du centre ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de sa famille.  Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter  des pièces de pagnes, jupes, souliers, sacs à mains, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Buralike is a courageous shopkeeper and a member of the business group Bienheureuse. A senior entrepreneur at the age of 30, she is married and the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She sells a variety of clothing in a store in the center of the city. She began this business with funds received from her family eight years ago. Her husband is also a shopkeeper. This new loan will allow her to purchase traditional cloths, skirts, shoes, hand bags, etc. She hopes to increase her revenues, build a home, keep sending her children to school, and see to the clothing and food needs of her family. She would like to thank Hekima for their empowerment of unbankable female entrepreneurs, in particular during this time of conflict in the east of her country.

loans.use: purchase traditional cloths, skirts, shoes, hand bags, etc.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is a hardworking father from the town of Corella, Bohol. He is married with four children, ages to 14,13, 11, and 7 years old respectively. He operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic commodities, ranging from canned goods, coffee, cooking oil, noodles and condiments. He is also engaged in carpentry work to help augment the income of the household. He is paid per week to meet the family's daily expenses. 

His sari-sari store business started six years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy additional grocery items, firewood, and many other, to fill his store with stocks and cater the customers needs.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and increase business profitability for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, firewood, and many other.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell cashew nuts business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP through NWTF to purchase additional cashew nuts to resell for her buy-and-sell cashew nuts business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years. Evelyn earns more income from farming vegetables.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional cashew nuts to resell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell in her general store business.  Norma has been in this business for 4 years but also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested a new loan to further build her business.  Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Camila Andrea

texts.es:
Desde el año 2011 a mediados de noviembre Camila Andrea tomo la decisión de estudiar en el INSTITUCIÓN CAMPO ALTO, gracias a que el Colegio Pedagógico Dulce María,  mantenían un convenio llamado Gestores en Crecimiento;  por medio de este la joven ingreso a ser una estudiante perteneciente a este plantel, matriculada en el programa de auxiliar en enfermería.
Escogiendo ella esta carrera, ya que desde muy pequeña la meta es ser una gran profesional en el área de la salud, esperando algún día poder especializarse en pediatría. Siendo la inspiración para seguir adelante es la hija para lograr darle un buen futuro. Con el pasar del tiempo esta joven ya va cursando el segundo semestre en la institución obteniendo muy buenos resultados en las materias.
Camila terminando ya el segundo semestre dijo que aplazaría las prácticas ya que estaba en embarazo y pronto nacería el bebe, así mismo después de esto entraría a la licencia de maternidad. 
El motivo por el cual Camila necesita el convenio con KIVA es porque los gastos ahora incrementaron mucho más y con esta ayuda se le haría más fácil para pagar las cuotas ya que el costo es mucho más flexible.
texts.en:
In mid-November, 2011 Camila Andrea, made ​​the decision to study at Campo Alto, thanks to an agreement between them and 'Dulce María' School, called Ambassadors for Growth. Through this agreement, she became a student enrolled in the nursing assistant program.  
Showing interest for this field since a very young age, her goal is to become an excellent professional in the medical field, hoping someday to specialize in pediatrics. Her daughter is who inspires her to be better as she works hard to provide her with a better future. She is currently enrolled in her second semester of classes, with remarkable grades. Camila decided to postpone her training as she is now pregnant and her baby is soon due, and she would go on maternity leave, shortly after.
As her expenses have increased significantly, this loan from KIVA will make it easier for her to pay her tuition fees and make her costs much more manageable.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Tophas

texts.en:
Tophas is a 52-year-old married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in farming as her main source of income alongside coffee produce. She started this business to earn a living and look after her family. She faces a challenges of weather changes and banana bacterial wilt that affect her bananas. 

She has hopes that in future she will expand her plantation, which will in turn increase her income.
Tophas is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Amabel

texts.en:
Amabel is a married woman and a mother to three young children.  She is from Tagbilaran, Bohol in the Philippines and has raised hogs as a business for more than two years.  Her husband works as a driver. Amabel works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Amabel is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.  With this loan she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her yield and profit.  In the future, Amabel hopes of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Raul Alfredo

texts.es: Raul tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, su hijo de 16 años y su hija de 10 años de edad. Raul es un hombre visionario quien con mucho esfuerzo se ha hecho de un pequeño taller de reparación de equipo de refrigeración e instalación de aire acondicionado. De esta forma es como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a su familia lo necesario. Raul desea comprar un compresor para su taller pero no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra del compresor que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
Raul is 41 years old and lives in his own house alongside his wife, his 16-year-old son and his 10-year-old daughter. Raul is a visionary man who with great effort, has created a small shop for repairing refrigeration equipment and installing air conditioning. In this manner, he provides for his household's sustenance and provides his family with what they need. 

Raul wants to buy a compressor for his shop but he lacks the necessary capital to make the purchase. For that reason, he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in purchasing the compressor he so badly needs.

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to resell to her customers.

Evelyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa works hard to support her family.  She is married and has operated a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for 11 years now.

Leonisa requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leonisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Zoraya Margoth

texts.es: Zoraya tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 7 años que estudia en una escuela de su localidad,  Zoraya vive con su hija y comenta que ella es padre y madre para su niña ya que el padre de su hija no se hace cargo de ella, Zoraya se dedica a la agricultura, en sus sembríos y también se va a trabajar al jornal. Necesita el crédito para comprar fungicidas y abono para cultivar papas, dice que le va bien sembrando papas ya que su trabajo lo realiza con mucho empeño y que ella hace todo en beneficio de su hija. La más grande aspiración de Zoraya es poder darle la educación a su hija y que llegue a ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Zoraya is 28 years old. She is a single mother of a 7 year old daughter, who goes to school in the neighborhood. Zoraya lives with her daughter and says that she plays both the mother and father role for her, as the father is not a presence in her life. Zoraya is a farmer. She tends to her crops, but also works as a day laborer for others.
She needs this loan to buy fungicides and fertilizers to farm potatoes. She says that she is very successful because she puts hard work into it, and she makes it all for her daughter. Zoraya's biggest goal is to provide her daughter with an education so she can become a professional some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungisides

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 39 years old and has seven children who are currently in school. In the picture, Mary Ann is having a pose with her regular customers.

Mary Ann has a internet cafe business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional unit of computer and spare parts for her business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional unit of computer and spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth De Maria

texts.es: Doña Elizabeth es originaria de La Concordia-Jinotega, soltera y madre de cuatro hijos. Tiene 36 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y prendas de plata. Inicio su negocio con el apoyo de su mama quien la apoyo en la idea de poner su propio negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos. Su meta próxima es seguir apoyando a sus hijos en lo que necesiten. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Cosméticos, y Prendas de plata. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar sus ventas. Su plan futuro es contratar a una persona que le ayude en el negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is originally from La Concordia-Jinotega.  She is 36 years old, single, and the mother of four children.  She works as a merchant, selling cosmetics and silver jewelry.  She started her business with the support of her mother, who supported the idea of opening her own business to earn more income.  Her next goal is to continue supporting her children with what they need.

She is requesting this loan to purchase cosmetics and silver jewelry.  She believes the loan will be a lot of help since it will increase her sales.  Her plan for the future is to hire someone to help with the business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Alba Ela

texts.es:
Doña Alba es una señora con una edad de 45 años, su educación es de primaria incompleta cursando únicamente hasta el segundo año de primaria ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarle. Doña Alba es casada, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y de su matrimonio tienen siete hijos involucrándose todos como familia en las diferentes actividades que se desarrollan en el campo. La menor de todos los hijos está en 5 años de primaria en la escuela de la comunidad, los otros tres trabajan fuera de la comunidad en un aserradero y los otros tres solo cursaron la primaria hasta sexto grado y decidieron ayudar a sus padres en las diferentes actividades de campo. Dedicándose exclusivamente a la siembra de hortalizas (zanahoria) ya tiene más de 6 años en esta actividad pero también para generar mayores ingresos a su familia y no solo depender de dicho rubro su otra fuente de ingresos es la alfarería siendo su mercado local vendiendo ambos productos a proveedores e intermediarios de la zona. Ella agradece a DIOS por haber dado una propiedad que su tierra fuera altamente productora en la cual también está construida su casa de habitación permitiendo esto dar una mayor y mejor asistencia a sus cultivos; pero para transportar el producto a mercado ellos viajan en auto bus de la ruta por más de 15 kilómetros.
Sus metas mejorar su calidad de vida aumentar más su área de cultivo y poder sembrar una diversificación de producto para no depender únicamente de la zanahoria. Como madre poder apoyar a su última hija con su educación ya que le gustaría que ella pudiese prepararse académicamente. Doña Alba solicita apoyo financiero con el cual comprara los insumos agrícolas necesarios para poder dar la asistencia a sus cultivos de zanahoria y poder cosechar un excelente producto al final de la temporada.
texts.en:
Doña Alba is a 45 year old woman. She was unable to finish secondary school and only completed the second year of primary school because her parents had limited resources and were not able to help her. Doña Alba is married, her husband works as a farmer, and they have seven children who are all involved in different activities in the agricultural business. The youngest of them is in the fifth year of primary school in the community, three work outside the community at a sawmill and three were only able to finish the sixth grade of primary school and then they decided to help their parents in the fields. They have dedicated themselves exclusively to growing carrots for the past 6 years. To earn more money for their family, and so as not to depend entirely on carrots, they also make pottery and they sell both products in the local market directly to customers and to buyers. She thanks God for having giving her a property that is highly productive and where she also has her home, giving her the ability to give more and better attention to her crops. However, in order to transport her products to market, she needs to travel by bus for more than 15 kilometers. 
Her goals are to improve her quality of life, increase her area of cultivation, and to be able to plant a greater diversity of crops so she won't have to depend on just carrots. As a mother, she wants to be able to help her youngest child with her education and she would like her to follow an academic route. She is asking for financial assistance so she can purchase agricultural supplies that she needs in order to grow her carrots and to be able to harvest an excellent product at the end of the season.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies for growing carrots.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” está conformada por 11 socios responsables y trabajadores. Sabina de 29 años es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Actualmente trabaja en una tienda de abarrotes lo cual le ha permitido cubrir los gastos del hogar. El deseo de Sabina es implementar su propio negocio con la experiencia que tiene. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas.  El grupo “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Sabina se encuentra sentada, es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo violeta.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” (The Effort Is Great) consists of 11 responsible and hardworking members.

Sabina is 29 years old, married, and has two dependent children. She currently works at a grocery store, which enables her to cover her household expenses. Sabina wants to establish her own business with the experience she has. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy groceries, beverages, and snack foods.

The Communal Bank “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” appreciates everyone who made this loan possible, so they promise to continue working well with each other. In the photo, Sabina is seated third from the right and is wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages, and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Luz  Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz continues to work at her grocery store.  She sells rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She has had this business for many years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Dorita Asuncion

texts.es:
Dorita Asunción tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de plátano, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de plástico y productos de belleza en los caseríos cercanos a su distrito desde hace tres años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Dorita Asunción, age 33, lives with her husband and child in the Buenos Aires district.  It is a community that devotes itself to agriculture, especially growing bananas, commerce, and livestock.  It is located in the Morropon Province in the Piura Region on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been selling plastic and beauty products in the settlements close to her district for three years.

She has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to buy a greater quantity of products to offer her customers.  This way she will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 45 years old and married with four children.

Lita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to resell in her general store.

Lita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns an income from ice cream vending.

Lita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Merza

texts.en:
Merza works hard to support her family. Merza is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Merza requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to resell in her general store.

Merza has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Merza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Michille

texts.en:
Michille has a live-in partner with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Michille is 31 years old and has one child who is in school.

Michille has a food vending business in the Philippines. Michille requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Michille has been in this business for six years. Michille would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: José Aquilino

texts.es:
José es joven de 24 años, luchador y esmerado por alcanzar sus metas, actualmente acompañado, tienen 2 niños a quienes aman y aprecian muchísimo. Ella(compañera de vida de José) es una muchacha que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia y ayudarle a su compañero de vida. José por sus escasos recursos económicos logro estudiar hasta el 6º grado de educación básica, desde muy pequeño aprendió el trabajo que su padre hacia (sembrar hortalizas).

Actualmente él se dedica a la siembra de chiles, tomates y ejotes el cual es el trabajo que le ayuda a llevar el sustento para su familia. 

el préstamo que esta soliictando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizantes para su siembra (abono y pesticidas para la plaga).

Él a futuro sueña ver  a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales, algo que él no pudo lograr. Con su trabajo y dedicación sabe que lograra y podrá sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old.  He struggles and dedicates himself to achieving his dreams.  He is married and has two children who he loves and appreciates a lot.  José's life partner is a woman who makes an effort to help him and have their family succeed.  José was only able to attend school through sixth grade due to a lack of financial resources.  He learned to plant vegetables from his father when he was very young.

He currently works planting chili peppers, tomatoes, and green beans to support his family.  He is requesting a loan from CrediCampo to purchase fertilizers, manure, and pesticides for his crops.  

In the future, he hopes to see his children become professionals, which is something he could not achieve.  With his hard work and dedication, he knows that he can achieve that and be able to move his family forward.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, and pesticides.

loans.name: Rosa Judith

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Judith se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa Judith continues with her restaurant business.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches, and dinners.  She has had this business for several years, and it is going very well for her.  She wants to get ahead through this business.  Her dream is to expand her business.

She is requesting the loan to buy products for cooking.  She will buy things like meat, vegetables, and chicken.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy products like meat, vegetables, and chicken to use when cooking.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Due to high cost of commodities, Mary Rose engages in selling fish and frozen foods to help her husband in gaining income. She aims to improve and make her business profitable in order to sustain the necessities of her family. 

She plans to acquire more stocks of the said products to sell but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of fish and frozen foods to sell in the local community. She is hoping that her loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 55-year-old woman from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is married with five children. The oldest is 31, while the youngest is 17 year old respectively. Her husband works in a shop to support their family. 

She engages in charcoal-making business. She sells charcoal as her main source of income. She also engages in making and selling tuba (coconut wine) to augment her income. Her charcoal business started a quite years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy empty coconut shells and tongog (the color red pigment that changes the wine from bitter to sweet taste). 

In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business and increase the business profitability for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy empty coconut shells and tongog ( changes the wine taste from bitter to sweet).

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is 47 years old and chose to be single. She lives in a rural community and engages herself in a vegetable vending business to generate income. Due to financial hardships, she aims to improve her business in order to increase her income. She plans to acquire more stocks of vegetables to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP8,000 to buy additional stocks of tomatoes, bitter melon, garlic, onions, beans, dried fish, squash and sweet potatoes to sell. Being kind and industrious, she hopes that someday, she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of tomatoes, bitter melon, garlic, onions, beans, dried fish, squash and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with ten children and is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Nelia is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.  She operates a plastic bag making business in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.  She has operated this business for 30 years.

In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her plastic bag making business

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 47 years old and married with five children. With her children currently in school, Nila works very hard to provide for them.

Nila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.

Nila has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, candies, juice, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Nila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is single and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Rosalie has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Flordeliz requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like oil, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Flordeliz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like oil, sardines and noodles to sell

loans.name: Belmore

texts.en:
Belmore works hard to support his family. Belmore is married and has a livestock business in the Philippines.  Belmore requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.  Belmore has been in this business for 37 years now.

In the future, Belmore would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Gima

texts.en:
Gima is 37 years old and married.  She has three children, who are all in school. Gima works very hard to provide for them.  Gima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Gima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 45 years old and married.  She has five children. With three children currently in school, Emily works very hard to provide for them.  Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.  Emily has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as detergent soap, sugar, soft-drinks, canned goods, shampoo, bread and other groceries. 

Emily would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 57 years old, and married with three children, with one child currently in school.  She is in the agricultural pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Josephine requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Josephine has been in the pig fattening business for 17 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Seyde

texts.ru: Сейде 64 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Сейде - среднее образование, она швея-закройщица, работает по своей специальности, дополнительно Сейде занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сейде, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок, 12 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сейде обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сейде планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Seyde is 64, married and raising 3 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high-school education and works primarily as a seamstress and pattern-maker.  She also raises livestock on the side, first starting 18 years ago with 10,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistence, she currently has 2 dairy cows, a horse, a bull calf and 12 sheep on her farm, while her monthly income is nearly 15,000 som.  To further develop her farm, Seyde is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy some cows.  She plans on using any additional earnings due to the loan to buy even more cattle for her farm.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida works hard to support her family. Adelaida is separated and has a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines.

Adelaida requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a shampooing station and supplies in bulk (nail polishes, dyes, and hair treatments).

loans.name: Morina

texts.en:
