Morina is 60 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Morina has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Morina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Morina has been in this business for 8 years. Morina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new furniture and inputs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jayro Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jayro de 27  años de edad,  tiene tres hijos  que depende de él, vive con su esposa y no  tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace tres años al negocio de venta de chatarra, como ser bronce, cobre, hierro, lata, pasticos, sus clientes son las personas que se dedican a comercializar o transformar estos productos.
Don Jayro  se levanta temprano y se va en su carro a los diferentes barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo a recolectar este producto.
Don Jayro  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como plástico, metal, latas, etc. y así revenderlos y con el préstamo suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que tiene para esta ocasión ya que le venden este producto bien barato y desea embodegarlo para luego conseguir buenas utilidades. 
 Su sueño es tener  su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -   Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Jayro is 27 years old and has three dependent children.  He lives with his wife, and does not own his own home.  For three years, he has been engaged in the business of selling scrap materials such as bronze, copper, iron, silver, and plastic.  His customers are the persons engaged in marketing or transforming these products.

Jayro arises early and goes out in his car to various neighborhoods and communities in San Lorenzo to collect this product.  He is requesting the loan to purchase more products such as plastic, metal, silver, and other materials to resell. The loan will meet his funding needs at this time as they sell this product very cheap, and he wishes to store it and then get good profits.  His dream is to own his own home.
.

loans.use: to purchase plastic, metal, silver, and other materials for his business.

loans.name: Gotitas De Miel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GOTITAS DE MIEL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Salome es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de busos, tejido de mantas, venta de salchipapas, venta de medias, venta de material escolar, cerrajería, carpintería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Salome es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medias; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un poco capital que tenía y con el asesoramiento de su amiga, misma que le guío en el negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de medias por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el área de salud y el ahorro le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen falta una socia porque se encontraba en el área de salud, realizando su consulta médica.
texts.en:
The Gotitas de Miel community bank is starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional center.  The group is made up of 10 members and led by an executive board where Salome is the president.  The members of the group have a variety of businesses including a neighborhood store, clothing sales, knitting blankets, salchipapa sales, sock sales, school supply sales, a locksmith shop, and carpentry.  

The loan they are requesting will benefit all of their small businesses, including Salome's.  She said this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer.  She joined at the invitation of a counselor from the institution who visited her home.  She has a business selling socks.  She started this business with a small amount of capital that she had and the guidance of a friend.

She is requesting this loan to increase her capital and purchase socks at wholesale.  She will purchase them at the markets in the city of El Alto and later sell them in her store.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is single and has five children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings, health services, and savings that the institution offers.  

One member is missing from the picture because she was at health services at a medical appointment.

loans.use: to purchase socks at wholesale.

loans.name: Ferderika

texts.en:
Ferderika is a 40-year-old woman who is married to Imanuel, a 42-year-old man. They are blessed with six children. The oldest daughter is currently studying in Senior High and the youngest one is a 5-year-old girl.
 
Ferderika has been running a kiosk business for the last four years to support her family's needs. She initiated this business using her own capital of IDR 3,000,000. It was spent on a refrigerator and cake ingredients.
 
She started the business by selling some cakes and fruity ice blocks. Now she also sells other items at her kiosk such as sugar, instant coffee, snacks, dish soap, etc.
 
In order to restock her kiosk business, she requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. The loan will be spent on sugar, instant coffee, snacks, dish soap, fruity ice blocks, cakes ingredients, etc.

loans.use: to buy sugar, instant coffee, snacks, dish soap, fruity ice blocks and more

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.en:
Cayetano is a married man and a father of five children from Loon, Bohol. He has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Cayetano is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed for the pigs. With this, he will be able to improve his hog raising business, thus augmenting his income and profit. In the future, Cayetano hopes to make his business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ruby works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Ruby is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, noodles, milk, etc. to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles and milk to sell

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.  Nieves has been in this business for three years. Nieves earns additional income from pig fattening.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Nenita is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Nenita has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Nenita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Nenita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 46 years old and married with three children.

Pablita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Pablita has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas.

Pablita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам 57 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитывают 2 детей. У Мукарам - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мукарам занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мукарам, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мукарам обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мукарам планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома для сына.
texts.en: Mukaram is a 57-year-old widow who's been raising 2 children by herself since her husband's death.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and raises livestock for a living, first starting 22 years ago with 10,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistence, she currently has a dairy cow and 10 sheep on her farm, while her monthly income is nearly 20,000 som.  To further develop her farm, Mukaram is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy some cows.  She is planning on using any additional earnings due to the loan to buy even more cows for her farm, as well as to set aside money to buy a house for her son.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Nemfa

texts.en: In a village of Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, ZDS, Philippines, Nemfa runs a general store to make a living.  Her husband earns an income through fishing, which provides their main source of income. With her generated revenue from the business her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. She tries to sustain her business in order to support her children's education. Recently she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She is hopeful that this will permit her to generate more income and bring success to the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en: Bryan, 17, is the second child of four siblings and is studying for an Associate degree in Electrical Installation Maintenance at a university. He lives with his family and he wants to achieve success through education. His parents served their community as a barangay official and a teacher. Bryan joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a new loan to pay school tuition fees. Bryan is thankful for the cooperative that helps deserving students fulfill their dreams. In the future, he wants to finish his courses and develop his skills to use them for excellent service. Bryan always wants to do his best for himself and for his family as well.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
Franco  vive en la ciudad de Lambayeque, es un hombre muy carismático y sobre todo vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos, por quienes lucha cada día para poder salir adelante y brindarles una vida digna. Cada día franco sale a trabajar con mucho entusiasmo, el es chofer de mototaxi, oficio que le permite tener ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar, asimismo, trabaja como maestro de construcción, con lo cual puede tener un dinero extra para su familia.

Franco está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una maquina de coser industrial, con lo cual podrá apoyar a su esposa ya que ella realiza trabajos de costura y confección, de esta manera su esposa podrá apoyar a Franco con los gastos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su empresa de confecciones”.
texts.en:
Franco lives in the city of Lambayeque with his wife and two children. He is a very charismatic man, but most of all, he strives each day to get ahead and provide a decent life for his family. Each day, Franco leaves for work with great enthusiasm. He is a motorcycle taxi driver, a profession that allows him to earn income for meeting his household expenses. In addition, he is a master builder and this job allows him to earn some extra income for his family.

Franco is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to buy an industrial sewing machine. This will help his wife since she receives sewing and dressmaking jobs, which gives her the ability to help Franco with the expenses. Franco continues to strive toward fulfilling his greatest wish of seeing his wife have her own sewing business.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine for his wife to use.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as having potential. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes and also keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenges to be poor weather and roads. Richard will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow to enable him to increase milk production. His business goal is to own at least six dairy cows within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will do large scale dairy farming. He will use the anticipated profits to add more cows.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nestor Francisco

texts.es: Néstor es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, casado y padre de un hijo. Tiene 34 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración de ventanas de vidrio. Inicio su negocio como ayudante de su hermano y poco a poco fue aprendiendo el negocio y así lo ha ido perfeccionando hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es suplir la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Vidrio, Aluminio, entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ingresos con la venta de sus productos. Su plan futuro es incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Néstor, 34, is originally from the city of Estelí. He is married and has a son. He is a merchant who sells glass windows. He started his business by helping his brother. Little by little, he learned about the business, and he has continued to improve ever since. 

His main goal is to fulfill his clients' demand. He has applied for a loan to buy glass and aluminum, among other products. He believes that this loan will be of great help to him because he will be able to earn a better income by selling his products. His plan for the future is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy glass and aluminum, among other products.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital and refrigeration facilities. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes that in the future she will build a permanent house. This is her seventh loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to resell

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a market place and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to sell the goods at wholesale. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to save and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Daisy May

texts.en: Daisy May is a single entrepreneur who operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also sells snacks to earn extra income. After three years of running the store, she earns enough to support her needs and has been able to sustain her business. She has taken a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en: Jecinta is a 40 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be determined and focused. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes, clothes, beauty products and phone accessories. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for business and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She also runs an M-pesa business to earn extra income. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy stock of shoes, clothes and other items she sells. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stock of shoes, clothes and other items she sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Shelmith

texts.en: Shelmith is a 26-year-old married woman. She has one child who is four months old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells compact discs and DVDs. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are small scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more CDs and DVDs. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more compact discs and DVDs.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is a 27-year-old woman with two children. She runs a small plantation to earn a living and she has been doing this for many years. Imeleta has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, chemicals, backpack sprayer, safety boots, water tank, taro roots, and banana tube to assist her in running the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014. Imeleta will use the profits for her family's everyday needs and hope to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, chemicals, backpack sprayer, safety boots, water tank, taro roots, and banana tube.

loans.name: Davaakhuu

texts.en: Davaakhuu and her husband run a non-governmental organization that provides vocational training to people. She is requesting a loan of 875 USD to buy a computer and projector for lecturing. As a result of these purchases, her teaching can reach a lot of people and it will ease her work. Many past participants of her lectures praise her hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to buy a computer and projector for lecturing.

loans.name: Nemi

texts.en: Through patience and hard work, Nemi believes that he will be able to improve his living conditions. He is 62 years old and widowed. Aside from farming, he also operates a motorcycle transport business, in order to generate additional income. In order to continue using his motorcycle, he is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He is hoping that this loan will help him to strengthen the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 31-year-old single man. He describes himself to be experienced. He operates an electronics repair shop where he repairs electronics. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy equipment for repairing electronics. His business goal is to expand the business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully. Simon will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy equipment for repairing electronics.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a 33-year-old woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be visionary and focused. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a promising place and her primary customers are individual customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy stock of tailoring material. Her business goal is to be a successful tailor within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful dress maker.

loans.use: to buy tailoring material.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He has two children. He operates a retail business where he sells electronic items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. His business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 38 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 to 16 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread, salt and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for the business and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. Mary will use her KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sweets, sugar and other items. Her goal is to have a magnificent business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 25,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sweets, sugar and other items

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she grows tea for sale. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in a fertile place and her primary customers are factories. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use her KES 40,000 loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 23-year-old married man. He has one child who is six months old. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, flour, juice, cooking oil and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a favorable area and his primary customers are small scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low returns. 

Peter will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, juice, cooking oil and other items for resale. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, juice, cooking oil and other items for resale.

loans.name: Yudy Yazmin

texts.es:
Ella se llama yudy yazmín el anhelo es estudiar una carrera que le brinde muchas oportunidades de vida y que además de eso le guste lo que hace y se dedique a ella, pensó en muchas opciones pero finalmente se decidió a estudiar  enfermería ya que para ella el pensamiento es ayudar a las otras personas sin recibir nada a cambio, la oportunidad de estudiar enfermería es un paso hacer muchas cosas por la vida de los demás, ya que una enfermera sabe  que al final de una dura jornada se irán para la casa con la confianza y la tranquilidad de una buena labor prestada, es que Lo más gratificante de ser enfermera no es el sueldo que llega a la casa, pues se va con las manos llenas de las palabras de gratitud y las muestras de afecto derramadas de los ojos de una madre agradecida por haber limpiado la herida del pequeño, o la mirada cálida de un esposo que deposita toda la confianza en ella mientras atiende a la mujer que lleva a el hijo en el vientre, o  aún el apretón de dedos de un bebé que no ha salido aún de cuneros; o  mejor aún ancianito que con esa mirada llena  de felicidad le dice gracias por aliviar el dolor, esos son los momentos que hacen de esta carrera una carrera gratificante, emocionante y sobre todo humana. Por lo tanto, ninguno de los aspectos negativos de esta profesión puede compararse con lo bien que se siente ayudar y aliviar. Es por eso que yudi  decide estudiar enfermería para ayudar con la carrera a todas esas personas que necesiten de los cuidados, de la dedicación, pero sobre todo de esa responsabilidad que debe tener  una enfermera con el paciente porque nada es  más importante que la vida de las personas que toda la unidad médica tiene en las manos. 
El convenio con kiva le sería de gran ayuda, ya que ella se economizaría un dinero al momento de realizar los pagos y ese dinero lo puede invertir en los gastos que puede tener en la casa o en los gastos que tiene el estudio, ya que muchas veces en dinero no alcanza para poder pagar las mensualidades y tampoco para los gastos que ella tenga.
texts.en:
Yudy Yazmin's wish is to study a degree which will offer her many opportunities in life. She also wants to enjoy and dedicate herself to her work. She considered many options and finally decided to study nursing. Her aim is to help other people without receiving anything in return. 

The opportunity to study nursing is a path towards doing many things for other people's lives. At the end of the day, a nurse can go home feeling confident and calm, knowing that she has done good work. The most gratifying thing about being a nurse is not the salary one receives, but rather having one's hands full of words of gratitude and signs of affection in the eyes of, for example, a mother grateful for her child's wound being cleaned, or the warm expression of a husband who places all of his trust in the nurse while she cares for his pregnant wife, or even the squeeze of a baby's fingers who has still not left its bassinet. 

These are the moments that make nursing a gratifying, emotional, and above all human career. None of the negative aspects of the profession can compare with how good it feels to help and relieve patients. This is why Yudy decided to study nursing, to help those people who need care and dedication. Nurses have a responsibility to those patients who are under the care of the medical system, as nothing is more important than a person's life.

This Kiva loan will be of great help to her because she will be able to save some money at the time when she needs to pay her tuition. She can invest this money in the household expenses or costs related to her studies, as she often does not have enough money to pay her tuition as well as her other expenses.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition fees.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, 50, lives in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Memot district, Cambodia. He is married and has three children. For the last 12 years, Sary has been growing cassava and raising pigs. The current business earns him about 100,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs but he can save about 40,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Sary is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now he is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for his farmland and to buy pigs and pig feeds. He hopes to make more income from his current business so as he can expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Machacamarca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MACHACAMARCA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Esther es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de papa, confección de ropa, venta de producción de leche, elaboración de mantas, compra y venta de refrescos, producción de chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Esther es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de confección; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde corta edad ya que ellos tenían el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Machacamarca” communal bank will start their third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional center.  This group is comprised of nine members and is managed by a board of directors where Esther is president.  The members of the communal bank are engaged in varied types of businesses including potato production, clothes-making, selling dairy products, making blankets, buying and selling soft drinks, and chuño [traditional dried potato] production.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small microbusinesses where Esther is a member.  She says that she joined in Pro Mujer’s third cycle, and became a member at the invitation of an adviser that came to visit her in her home.  Currently, she has a clothes-making workshop; she states that she learned this business from her parents from an early age because they have the same business.  

The loan she is taking out now is to increase working capital.   She will purchase wholesale fabric, which she will acquire in the stores in El Alto.  After production, she will market her clothing in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family as she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.   When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training the institution offers her.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fabric.

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Sivorn, 54, is married with six children residing in a rural village located in the Kandal Stoeng province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. For the last 31 years, she has been farming rice as the primary source of her family’s income. She can earn about US $25 per day to support her family.

Sivorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back her past loan. Now she is requesting a loan to pay for her son’s university tuition fee to study Information Technology. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her son to university and help her son to obtain a higher educational background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, bread, salt, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of soap, salt, bread and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of soap, salt, bread and other items

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 51-year-old woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 15 to 24 years. She describes herself as responsible and hardworking. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for the business and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate capital. She will use her KES 20,000 loan to buy an M-pesa float (money for customers to withdraw). Her business goal is to create employment within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy an M-pesa float

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as being visionary and focused. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His primary customers are individuals. He will use his KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to be a successful clothes seller within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 53-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as being visionary and focused. She operates a retail business where she sells juice, water and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. She also owns a farm where she keeps dairy cows for milk production. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use her KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of juice and water, as well as farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy more stock of juice and water, as well as farm inputs.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 45, lives with his wife and children in a village in the Bakan district, an area of Pursat province. The people there work in agriculture, animal/poultry husbandry and trading. Phally works as a policeman in the region and earns additional income from farming. He has been doing this for more than 20 years.

Phally would like to obtain a loan which he will use to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members and so as to improve his household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Phally is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, age 44, lives in a rural village in Kandal Province’s Kandal Stoeng District in Cambodia. She is married and has four children. For the last 11 years, Phalla has been farming rice and working as a garment worker. The current business earns her about 8 USD per day to meet her family’s needs.

This is the first loan for Phalla with VisionFund. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
On is 39 and married with six children, two of whom are his burden children. He describes himself as a poorly educated man who works in agriculture as the primary source of income for his family. He has been doing this for more than 15 years. Thanks to his hard work, he now has one hectare of farmland, on which he grows rice for his own use and for sale, with a daily income of KHR 20,000. 

With the goal of further developing his business, On would like to obtain a loan to buy fertilizer to enable him to give the best care to his crops. He hopes that in the future, he will develop his business so that it will be more productive and successful. He expresses his thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Orgoi

texts.en: Orgoi, 64, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been extracting and selling spar (a mineral) for a living since 2002. His wife is an inspector who is responsible for the safety of certain apartments. Orgoi is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy an excavator motor and high pressure pump for his business. As a result, his income will increase thus improve his family's living standards. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy an excavator motor and high pressure pump.

loans.name: Jhon Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Jhon Carlos se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un carro donde realiza servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jhon Carlos is still working in his transport business. He has a car which he uses to offer taxi services. He works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. He has had this business for several years and it is going very well. 

His dream is to buy a new car. He has applied for a loan to buy wheels for his car.

He is happy with this loan and he promises to comply with his payments.

loans.use: to buy wheels for his car.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children, ranging in age from 3 to 4 years. She describes herself as God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as low demand. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more shoes. Her business goal is to have a leading wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, Chan is aged 44 years and married with four children, three of whom are still in school. For more than four years, she has been buying and selling garbage such as cans and recyclable things. Besides this, she also makes snacks for selling and raises chickens in order to earn additional income. She can earn about KHR 50,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day for her future needs. 

Chan has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles while the other group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Chan has completely paid back her past loans, which have helped her better support her family as well as her current business. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy chickens to raise. She hopes to fatten her chickens so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Srun is now 32 years old and married. She has four children. Srun and her husband are farmers who grow rice and beans as their main business to support the family. Sometimes they work for others for a fee. They can earn about 33,000 KHR per day to support the family. 

Srun has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back her past loan, which helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is applying for a loan to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 44 años de edad y vive en casa propia de material seminoble hace 8 años con su esposa y 2 hijos en la comunidad de Colasay, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, su esposa le apoya en esta labor preparando la alimentación para los jornaleros que dan mantenimiento a sus cultivos, Ernesto ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para el pago de mantenimiento de sus cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 44, has lived with his wife and two children in his own house, made of semi-noble materials, in the village of Colasay for eight years. The village is dedicated to agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Ernesto works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. His wife supports him in this labor, preparing food for the day laborers who maintain his crops. Ernesto has applied for a loan of 2500 Peruvian nuevo soles to pay for the maintenance of his coffee crops, thereby having a better production to offer his clients.

loans.use: to pay day laborers to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon is 48 years old. He is married and raising five children together with his wife. Huon has a secondary education. Huon, with the full support of his wife, works in agriculture as an important source of income for his family. After having been in the farming business for nearly 30 years, he has developed it successfully and made it a viable source of income.

With an aim to further develop his business, Huon is asking for a loan of 750 USD to purchase a buffalo for maintenance at the rice field. With this buffalo, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his harvest and yields.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo for maintenance at the rice field.

loans.name: Dem

texts.en:
Dem is 31 years old and married. He lives with his family in a rural area located in the Kandal Stoeng District of Kandal Province. He has two dependent children to take care of. Rice farming is the only primary source of his family’s income, and he has been in this business for seven years. Sometimes, he works for others for a fee. With the current business, he can earn approximately 40,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the first microloan for Dem with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is applying for a loan to buy a decent motorbike to commute to work. He hopes to reduce some motor-taxi expenses to save some money for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 43 years old and married with six children, three of whom in school, Ma. Theresa works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Theresa's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ma. Theresa is taking out a bridge loan to restart her food vending business.

She has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her food vending business.

Ma. Theresais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase addtional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Латофат скромная, но очень трудолюбивая сельская женщина, которая проживает в районе Восеъ. Она женщина среднего возраста, ей 35 лет. У нее трое детей и им по 13, 10 и 6 лет. Двое посещают школу, а третий пойдет в этом году. Муж Латофат занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынке и одновременно помогает жене в ее деятельности. Латофат в течение 15 лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит молодых бычков для дальнейшей продажи. Для расширения и увеличения поголовья скота, Латофат берет кредит. Она хочет закупить несколько голов молодых бычков, так как уже начался благоприятный сезон для ведения животноводства, с приходом весны на местных пастбищах вырастает трава - корм для скотов.
texts.en:
Latofat is a modest but very hardworking country woman, who lives in the region of Vose. She is a woman of middle age; she is 35 years old. She has three children, and they are 13, 10 and 6 years old. Two of them attend school, and the third one will start this year. Latofat's husband works with selling food products at the market and at the same time helps his wife with her business. 

Latofat has worked with cattle breeding for a period of 15 years. She breeds young bulls for selling. Latofat takes a loan to expand and increase the number of livestock. She would like to purchase some young bulls, as the favorable season for cattle breeding has already started. With the arrival of spring, the grass grows on the local pastures - and this is fodder for cattle.

loans.use: to purchase some cattle in order to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala is a 49-year-old married women with 7 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Ala requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, vegetable oil and plastic bags to help her running the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. With her earnings, Ala will help provide for her children's education and everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, vegetable oil, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Paz En La Tormenta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PAZ EN LA TORMENTA” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pito de cebada, costura de edredones, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, venta de ropa, tejido de busos, costura de chamarras, venta de joyas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar la forma de comercio de otras persona, posteriormente con un poco capital decide implementarlo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, papa, cebolla y zanahorias) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le las capacitaciones en crédito y salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Paz en la Tormenta" [Peace in the Torment] village bank will start its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Pan-American central focus. It is made up of eleven members and is directed by a board where Silvia is the president. The businesses that the members of the village bank carry out are varied. Among them, there are: sale of barley products, sewing of quilts, selling of food, neighborhood store, knitting of sweaters, sale of clothing, knitting of sportswear, sewing of jackets, sale of jewelry.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microenterprises where Silvia is a member. She says that this is the second cycle that integrates Pro Mujer. She entered by the invitation of an aunt who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. It's worth mentioning that she learned this business observing the ways of business of other people. Previously, with a little capital, she decided to implement it.

The loan that she will take out now is for increasing capital (to buy rice, potatoes, onions and carrots). She will acquire them in the distribution stores in the city of El Alto and later will make and sell in her sale space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family since she lives with her partner and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that the likes the loan and health training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more metal bars and metal sheets for welding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, laundry soaps, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Marseline

texts.en:
Marseline is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed in business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 49 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

Monina has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Monina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody works hard to support her family. Melody is married and has a cultured pearl vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cultured pearl to sell.

Melody has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Melody would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cultured pearl to sell

loans.name: Ayan

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ayan works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Ayan is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Ayan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jakubosi

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 33-year-old Jakubosi from Masvingo. He is married with two children and one is attending school. Jakubosi runs a retail business selling motor vehicle tires. The business has been in operation for 3 years. He says the main challenge being faced is that of electricity blackouts affecting pressure compressors. 

Jakubosi has requested a loan of $500 to buy motor vehicle tires. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him an increase in income hence he will be able to buy a residential plot to build his own house. In the future Jakubosi plans to open a big shop trading all tire sizes.

loans.use: to purchase motor vehicle tires for resale.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is 48 years old and married. He has six children, two of whom are still in school. He lives in a rural village in the Kandal Stoeng District. To make a living, he is a motor-taxi driver, and sometimes he works for others for a fee. He has been in this business for 17 years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day to meet his family’s needs.

Sophal is in his first microloan with VisionFund. He is applying for a loan to buy a decent motorbike for his child to commute to work. He hopes to have a proper motorbike for his child to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for his child to commute to work.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is a 30-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as committed. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be demand fluctuation. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. He hopes that in the future, he will have a prominent business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a las zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y llantas para su mototaxi que le permitirán brindar un mejor servicio con mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Carlos, 23, lives in the Pucara district in a community with a hot climate.  The population here works in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.  This area is located in Jaen province, which is in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Carlos provides public transportation services with his own moto-taxi.  He transports his passengers to the outlying areas of the district.  He has requested a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy spare parts and tires for his moto-taxi.  This will allow him to provide better service with greater safety.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tires for his moto-taxi

loans.name: Editha

texts.es:
Editha tiene 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores gallos, gallinas, pollos, en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Editha se dedica a esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 300 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Editha is 59 years old.  She lives with her husband in the Oyotún district, located in Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru’s northern coast.  The community is dedicated to farming, trade, and raising cattle.  Editha is engaged in raising small animals, (roosters, hens, and chickens) in the back part of her house.  She is engaged in this work to help her husband with the family expenses.  She has requested a loan of 300 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals and in this way, charge her customers a better price, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals .

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 34 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell cultured pearl in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell .

Emma has been in this business for 2 years.

Shewould like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Progresivas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES PROGRESIVAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de material de construcción, venta de calzas, venta de café, ayudante de construcción, tienda de cerámica.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que es el quinto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió posterior a un trabajo que tenía, donde aprendido la técnica de costura, con un capital formado decide emprender su negocio.
 El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le las capacitaciones en crédito y salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Progresivas" [Progressive Women] will be starting their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Panamerica regional office. They are a group of nine members run by a board of directors, of which Celia is the President. The businesses of the members are varied, and include selling food, selling construction materials, selling coffee, assisting with construction, and a ceramics shop. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small microentrepreneurs, including Celia. This is her fifth year as a member with Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend who works with the institution. Currently she has a business sewing jackets: she explains that she began this business after a job that she had, where she learned sewing techniques, and with capital she had gotten together, she decided to start her business.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy fabric wholesale, which she will acquire in the stores of distributors in the city of El Alto. After sewing it, she will sell it in her place of sale. This way of working allows her to make an income to support her family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Celia said that she likes the training sessions in credit and health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale

loans.name: Corazon Valiente Group

texts.es: Organizado por la coordinadora,  Antonia, casada y  48 años de edad posee siete hijos dependiendo de ella únicamente dos hijos de  las edades de 19 y 17 años, posee una pulpería en el domicilio. El credito lo invertia en la compra de   productos como arroz, frijoles, jabón de lavar ropa, de baño, sopas magi, carne de res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, papel higienico, medicamentos populares etc, la cual ha venido ampliando con créditos otorgados, el grupo también lo integra la socia Jacinta con 51 años de edad la cual realiza artesanía en canastos y  la señora Ángela de 32 años  vende elotes y palma.
texts.en:
Organized by the coordinator, Antonia, who is married and 48. She has seven children; only two children, aged 19 and 17, are dependent upon her. She has a small grocery store in her home. She will invest the loan in the purchase of products like rice, beans, bath soap, laundry detergent, ramen noodle soup, beef, chicken, dairy products, toilet paper, popular medicines, etc., which she has increased with granted loans.

The group also has integrated the member Jacinta, 51, who makes artisan baskets and Ángela, 32, who sells corn and palm.

loans.use: to invest in products like rice, beans, bath soap, laundry detergent, ramen noodle soup, beef, chicken, dairy products, toilet paper, popular medicines, etc.

loans.name: La Golondrina Group

texts.es: Coordinado por la señora Lucila, es  soltera y madre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales ninguno depende de ella, se dedica a la venta de prendas de  plata y oro laminado, cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor, debido que ella le envía remesas y parte de las prenda que ésta ofrece, El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de prendas como cadenas, chapas, anillos, pulseras de pies, pulseras de manos, entre otros, para aumentar las ventas y obtener más remuneraciones por el trabajo desempeñado.  El grupo también lo conforman las señoras Juana de 53 años dedicada a la venta de tortilla en su domicilio y Mirna de 32 años quien tiene un puesto de abarrote en el mercado municipal.
texts.en:
This group is coordinated by Señora Lucila, a single mother of four children. None of them are dependent on her. She earns her living selling gold- and silver-plated items. She has her oldest daughter's help, as she sends her money and part of the goods that she sells. She will invest the loan in the purchase of items like chains, pendants, rings, ankle bracelets, bracelets, and more, in order to increase her sales and obtain better remuneration for the job she does. 

The group is also made up of Señora Juana, who is 53 years old and works selling tortillas from her house, and Señora Mirna, who is 32 years old and has a grocery stand in the municipal market.

loans.use: to invest in gold- and silver-plated items like chains, rings, bracelets, ankle bracelets, and related items.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 51 years old, married and a resident of Aguada,Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. Starting with capital of 8,000 PHP, she opened a small sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in February 2011 and has taken out three loans. She wishes to continue being a member in good standing and be able to manage her finances. If not for PMPC, she might not have any savings for future needs. Patricia only wants to live a happy and comfortable life and be able to help her nieces and nephews in their college education obligations.

loans.use: to restock basic commodities for her Sari-Sari store (general store) business.

loans.name: Ariston

texts.en:
Ariston is a 48-year-old man who is very responsible with his household obligations, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and five children. He is a farmer who plants rice, corn, vegetables, beans and root crops. Farming is his main source of income to sustain their family needs, especially for his children. 

Ariston wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase farm supplies and equipment, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home, and to generate savings for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Mutriba

texts.ru: Мутриба жительница северной части страны, города Конибодом. Она молодая и уже замужняя женщина в возрасте 23 лет. Мутриба детей еще не имеет. Ее муж уехал на заработки в чужие края, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Так как Мутриба энергичная и деятельная по натуре, она хочет начать свой бизнес. Мутриба уже арендовала торговую точку на рынке и хочет заняться продажей детской одежды. Чтобы привезти товар она просит кредит, поскольку ее собственного начального капитала не хватает. Данный кредит ей очень важен, благодаря ему у нее будет прибыльная работа.
texts.en:
Mutriba is a resident of the northern part of the country, the city of Konibodom. She is young and already a married woman, at the age of 23. Mutriba does not yet have any children. Her husband went abroad as a migrant worker in order to support his family.

As Mutriba is energetic and active by nature, she would like to start her own business. She has already rented a sales point at the market, and would like to start selling children's clothing. She requests a loan in order to purchase goods, since her private start-up capital is not sufficient. This loan is very important to her, as it will give her profitable work.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing to start a retail business

loans.name: Jorge Orlando

texts.es: jorge de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta y reparación de llantas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Jorge esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas, rines y tubos todo por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 47-year-old Jorge lives in his own house with his family. He has made a living for several years by selling and repairing tyres. His business is located in his home. He manages to settle some of the household expenses with what he obtains from his sales. Jorge is requesting a loan to purchase tyres, rims, and exhaust pipes wholesale so he can continue with his work, which generates good profits, and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tyres, rims, and exhaust pipes wholesale

loans.name: Isonia

texts.es: Isonia tiene 39 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa alquilada junto a sus dos hijos de 7 años y 7 meses de edad. Isonia se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace más de 5 años. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad y es así como mantiene  a sus hijos. Este negocio significa mucho para Isonia dado que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Como toda mujer visionaria ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de ropa usada al por mayor para satisfacer una mayor demanda de mercado que le permita mejorar sus ventas e ingresos. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la invención en la compra de ropa usada.
texts.en: Isonia is 39 years old. She is a single mother and she lives in a rented house together with her two children, who are seven years old and seven months old. For over five years, Isonia has made a living by selling used clothing. She sells on the streets of the main areas in her town and this is how she supports her children. This business means a lot to Isonia since she does not have any other source of income. As a woman of vision, she has made the decision to invest in her business by buying a variety of used clothing wholesale in order to satisfy the great demand in the market, which will enable her to improve her sales and revenue. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to make an investment in the purchase of used clothing.

loans.use: to buy used clothing wholesale and sell it

loans.name: Saomalie

texts.en: Saomalie is a 52-year-old, married woman with three children. She runs a small plantation to earn a living.  She has been doing this for many years. Saomalie requested for a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, rake, wheelbarrow, knife, safety boots, water tank, taro roots, banana tube, and a shovel to help her run the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.  Saomalie will use her profits to support her children’s education, the family’s everyday needs, and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, rake, wheelbarrow, knife, safety boots, water tank, taro roots, banana tube, and a shovel.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La socia Serafina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende blusas,pantalones,chompas y polos,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pantalones,chompas,blusas y casacas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Serafina continues working in the business of selling clothing. The member sells blouses, pants, sweaters and polos. The member already has several years' experience in this business and it's going very well for her. The member's dream is to have a place of business where she can sell clothing. The member is applying for the loan to buy pants, sweaters, blouses and jackets.

The member is happy because of the loan and promises to fulfill her repayment installments.

loans.use: to buy pants, sweaters, blouses and jackets.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo has been helping his wife run their own retail store for a living, observing that with the business they earn better income for the family. With his generated revenue, his previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. He is now requesting a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. He wants to improve their general living situation, as well as the business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 55 years old, married and a resident of Capucao,Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. Starting with capitalization of 8,000 PHP, she opened a small general store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member last February 2011 and has taken out three loans. She wishes to maintain her standing as a member in good standing and able to manage her finances. If not for PMPC, she might not have any savings for future needs. Anecita only wants to live a happy and comfortable life and be able to help her nieces and nephews in their college education obligations.

loans.use: To restock basic commodities for her general store.

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Teolinda tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y salchipollo, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teolinda is 63 and lives with her husband in the district of Morropon, a community that works in agriculture, business and animal husbandry. It is located in the province of the same name, which belongs to the Piura region, northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling beer and hot dogs. Her business is located in her home. She has a considerable clientele. She has applied for a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles for buying a greater quantity of beer to offer her customers. In this manner, she will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beer to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 39 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Cristine requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her business.

She has been a farmer for 10 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Cristine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her business.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 58 years old and widowed with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Jeana has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending and from buying and selling vegetables.

Jeana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en: Tofu is a 44-year-old married women with 4 children. She runs a small business of selling pork cake in her community. She has been doing this for many years to earn a living. Tofu requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a bottle of mushroom soya, a sack of salt, pork and a sack of sugar to assist her in running the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014. She will use her profits to assist with her family's everyday needs, and she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a bottle of mushroom soya, a sack of salt, pork and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar de 33 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, es originaria de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza  por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de  bolsas plásticas de diferentes tamaños bolsas de libra, bolsas, jardín, bolsas de dos libras. El dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de bolsas  plásticas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Cesar agradece la ayuda  que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Cesar is 33 years old, and single with children.  He is from Leon, located in the western region of the country.  Cesar characterizes himself as a hardworking, responsible person who wishes to improve himself.  Regrettably, because of lack of financial resources, he could not pursue a degree and was forced to work from an early age to help with the family expenses.
Thanks to his efforts and his desire to get ahead, he has a business selling plastic bags of various sizes: one-pound bags, garden bags, and two-pound bags.  He dedicates ten hours a day to his business, selling his product.   The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital, and stock his business with plastic bags, so that he will earn better income in the not too distant future.  Cesar is grateful for the help offered by the Kiva investors to persons of limited resources from poor countries such as Nicaragua because it provides them with a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and purchase plastic bags of various sizes to stock his business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 30-year-old, married woman. She has two children ages three years and six years. She describes herself to be optimistic. Lilian operates a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with a ready market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a hair dryer. Her business goal is to expand the clientele base within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is a 23-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are schools. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a bigger store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Lesbia

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia de 34 años de edad es soltera  no tiene hijos que dependen de ella vive con un familiar, en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de honduras.
Doña Lesbia  se dedica desde hace 07 años  al negocio de venta de pan, de todas las clases, sus clientes le prefieren por su amabilidad y buenos precios en sus productos, su clientela son los empleados de la empresa de camarón que hay en la zona también vende con los empleados de las fincas de melón y también a la comunidad.
Doña Lesbia  viaja en taxi todos los días por las tardes para poder vender el pan a la hora de salida de los empleados, es una joven emprendedora que está luchando por tener un buen negocio y tener su casa.
Doña Lesbia  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima, como ser; la harina, maíz, leña, huevos, manteca, etc. y latas de metal que son los moldes donde cocina el pan, con él a poyo de este crédito pretende salir adelante y aumentar más su patrimonio.
