Su sueño es tener su propia casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
34-year-old Lesbia is single and does not have any children. She lives with a relative in the community of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras.

For seven years, Lesbia has made a living by selling all sorts of bread. Her customers prefer her business because of her friendliness and the good prices of her products. Her clientele are employees of the shrimp business in the area. She also sells to the employees of the melon farms and to members of the community.

Lesbia catches a taxi every afternoon to sell her bread to the employees as they leave. She is an enterprising young woman who is determined to have a good business and her own house.

Lesbia is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies, such as flour, corn, firewood, eggs, butter, and metal tins for bread moulds. With the support of this loan, she will try to get ahead and increase her assets. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy flour, corn, firewood, eggs, butter, and other items for her business

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 42 years old and married with two children. Merlita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. Merlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Abucay

texts.en:
Abucay, a 46-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school, works very hard to provide for her family. Her business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. 

Abucay has requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to restart her general store business. She will use the loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Abucay is committed to rebuilding, and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy items to resell such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro is a married man and a father of three children from Panglao, Bohol. He has been engaged in making handicrafts for more than a year now. This is the source of income for the family. Alejandro is asking for a loan to buy more lumber, varnish and paint. With this, he will be able to improve his output thus augmenting the products that he can sell. In the future, Alejandro hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more lumber, varnish and paint.

loans.name: Aukusitina

texts.en: Aukusitina is a strong, 80-year-old woman with ten children. She runs a small plantation to earn a living, which she has been doing for many years. Aukusitina has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, shovel, safety boots, water tank, backpack sprayer, taro roots, banana tube, and chemicals to help her run the business.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Aukusitina will use her profits to help with her family’s everyday needs, and she hopes to expand her business for a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, shovel, safety boots, water tank, backpack sprayer, taro roots, banana tube, and chemicals.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 61-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with 2 grown children. She engages in a food vending business. She makes and sells snack food like suman (made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often wrapped in banana leaves and steamed) and puto (rice cake). This is her main source of livelihood. Her business started more than 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy assorted ingredients for the food vending business, to continue her livelihood activity.

In the future, she hopes to expand her food business and increase business profitability for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy assorted ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rodillo

texts.en: Rodillo, 52 years old and a father of three, operates his own farm to make a living. For many years of cultivating his farm, he was able to provide for his family. Farming is their main source of income. Rodillo wants to improve his farm produce to use the income for improving and renovating their house. To boost the farm, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase fertilizer. In the future, he wants to ensure that this farm, as their main of income, will be improved and produce more fruits to earn more for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's Solar Lighting Products

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Aziz lives in Lebak, a semi urban area about 3 hours from Jakarta. Aziz is married and lives with 3 people in the family home.
	
Aziz began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, he had around $18 – 19 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business develops, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Na

texts.en:
Na is 52 years old and has eight children, living in the area of Prey Chhor distric, Kampong Cham. 
She is in the agricultural business, farming rice and cassavas for sales in her region. Thanks to the business, she is able to provide for her family's basic needs and send them to school. Na has been in agriculture for almost 30 years.

Na is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to help her pay for plowing and preparing the land for cassava planting. As this is a major source of her income, she will strive to work with the loan support. After being with Hattha Kaksekar Limited, she can gain access to micro-finance services and it helps increase her ability to sustain her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and preparing the land for cassava planting.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio, from Panglao, Bohol, is a married man and a father of 4 children. He has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of his income. He is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them. With this, he will be able to improve his hog raising business, thus augmenting his income. Julio hopes to expand his business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his four children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita is a widow who earns a living from weaving lampakanay leaves. After more than six years in this business, she earns well to sustain their living. To add sales, she also buys ready-made or finished products to resell. For this reason, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more lampakanay woven products to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more lampakanay woven products to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 48 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural community with her two children. To have an additional source of income, she is engaged in direct selling of AVON and Natasha products within her community. She aims to continue and improve the business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of AVON & Natasha products to sell. She is hoping that her loan will be a great help to her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of AVON & Natasha products to sell

loans.name: Kgoern's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Memot district of Kampong Cham province, Kgoern is 36 years old and married. She has three children.To support the family, she and her husband have been growing cassava for ten years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Kgoern has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for one cycle already, and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Hav

texts.en: A villager from the Kampong Speu province, Borseth district, Hav is 44 years old, and widowed with four children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working as a tailor for 20 years. She can earn about USD 8 per day to support her family. Hav has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely paid back the loan, which has helped better support her family’s living. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s university. She hopes to keep him in school until graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university costs.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Назгуль - высшее образование. После окончания университета Назгуль работала в сельской библиотеке, на должности библиотекаря, затем вышла замуж. Выращиванием овощей Назгуль стала заниматься с 2008 года с 25,000 сом KGS. Назгуль вместе с мужем занимается выращиванием овощей на приусадебном участке мерою 0,30 ГА, Назгуль выращивает ранние сорта огурцов, моркови и капусты. Назгуль закупает семена элитных сортов и выращивает рассаду в парнике и высаживает по сезону. Поэтому овощи созревают ранним летом и Назгуль сдает овощи оптом. У Назгуль  имеются свои постоянные покупатели ее продукции. В летнее время Назгуль  сдает овощи с приусадебного участка, а в зимнее время Назгуль сдает морковь и капусту, которые закладывает в погреб осенью также у Назгуль имеется: 2 дойные коровы и овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгуль обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа высококачественных семян огурцов, моркови и капусты для посевных работ. Назгуль намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Назгуль планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее образование детей.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 29, married and raising 2 children together with her husband.  She has a university education, and upon graduating, worked in a village library as a librarian and got married sometime thereafter.  She began growing vegetables in 2008 with 25,000 som as startup capital.  Both she and her husband have been growing them on a 0.30-hectare plot of land adjoining their house, planting quick-growing varieties of cucumber, carrots and cabbage.  She typically stocks up on seeds of what are generally recognized to be the best varieties of these plants for each season, sprouts them in a greenhouse and then plants them.  Her vegetables are ready to harvest early in the summer, and she sells them wholesale.  She has several regular buyers for her vegetables.  She sells the vegetables from her plot of land in the summer, and, in the winter, sells carrots and cabbage that she's stored in her cellar in the fall.  Apart from vegetables, Nazgul also has a few animals on her farm (2 dairy cows and 2 sheep).

To further develop her farm, Nazgul is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy high-quality cucumber, carrot and cabbage seeds for the sowing season.  Nazgul is intent on getting a good harvest as this will bolster her family's finances.  She plans on using any extra earnings due to the loan to add more livestock to her farm, as well as to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: buy seeds to plant cucumbers, cabbage and carrots

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 42-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail business where she offers photocopying services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are students. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy photocopying paper. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good lifestyle. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy photocopying paper

loans.name: Nazario Elías

texts.es:
Don Nazario de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta  tercer grado, esta casado y solo vive con su esposa, ella solo se dedica a los oficios de la casa. Él no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que sus padres vivían muy pobres y no alcanzaban para mandarlo a la escuela, por lo que siempre lo dedicaron a trabajar desde muy niño.


Don Nazario, tiene 40 años de ser tractorista, pero hace 2 años tuvo un accidente y le amputaron la pierna izquierda, en una cooperativa, le dan trabajo como vigilante de los cañales, es asi como se gana el sustento diario para su familia y también quiere comprar unos novillos para engordarlos en repasto, para ello le ayudara un familiar.



Don Nazario, solicita $800.00, a CREDICAMPO, para comprar unos 3 novillos para engordarlos en repasto, ya que en la cooperativa donde trabaja, hay abundantes terrenos donde cuidar sus animales, esto ayudara a tener algunos ingresos adicionales, para mejorar su situación de vida actual.


Don Nazario, planea ahorrar, para comprarse unas vacas lecheras, para obtener ingresos para tener una mejor vida
texts.en:
Nazario, 60, studied through the third grade. He is married and he and his wife live together. His wife is dedicated to homemaking. Nazario didn't have the opportunity to study because his parents were very poor and did not have enough money to send him to school so he began to work at an early age.

Nazario operated a tractor for 40 years but, 2 years ago, he had an accident and had to have his left leg amputated. An organization gave him a job as a caretaker of the sugarcane fields. This is the livelihood of his family and he also wants to buy some cattle to fatten on pastureland to help his family.

Nazario is requesting $800 from CrediCampo to buy about 3 cattle for fattening on a private farm at the organization where he works. There is abundant land where he can care for their animals. This will help him have some additional income to improve his living situation today. 

Nazario plans to save money, buy a dairy cow, and earn more income for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase 3 cattle to raise.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng, 21, lives with her husband and one kid in a rural village of the Memot district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care for her child by growing cassava which she has been in the business of for two years. 
Heng has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Heng wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to relieve the family’s financial burden. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow her cassava healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
The group members are grateful to Kiva lenders for contributing towards their previous loan, which Pauline needed to pay tuition for her children. She did so and her children studied well. The group members want more money, though Pauline is now taking a break.

Zaituni is 35 years old and married, with four children who all attend school, and she is a member of Vision Group. Despite the fact that she earns little income, Zaituni has managed to provide all the necessities of her family.

She deals in the sale of clothes in the city center and she has been in business since 2007.  Zaituni is a very hardworking lady, since when no one would offer her help in the bringing up of her children, she still managed to provide the best to them through hard work.

Zaituni believes a lot in the conservation of her environment, and she does numerous activities to see that the environment is conserved, like planting trees in her compound, among others. Because of her effort, she now requires a loan for the completion of her sewage system - something that will help in maintaining proper hygiene in her home and in the neighborhood.

She therefore humbly requests the lenders to fund her in the completion of her sewage tank to maintain her environment and keep it safe from diseases that would be likely to breakout due to unsafe disposal of wastes. The extra members in the photograph are just resting this cycle, but signed on the waiver form.

loans.use: To complete construction of a water tank.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en: Myra, age 42, is married and blessed with one child. She owns and operates a food vending business, in particular a mini-eatery. She's been in this business for almost two years, earning a net income of about PHP 3,800 weekly. The net income that she earns will go to their daughter for her future. Due to insufficient funds Myra would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase raw meat, fish, chicken and vegetables to sell. She's hoping that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase raw meat, fish, chicken and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lesilaina

texts.en: Lesilaina is a 48-year-old, women with five children. She runs a small business selling chicken, and fish and chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lesilaina requested a loan to buy a sack of potatoes, fish, a box of chicken, a bottle of vegetable oil, a sack of salt, tomato sauce and plastic bags to help her run the business. She joined the SPBD in 2014. Lesilaina will use her earnings to help with her family’s everyday needs, and she hopes to expand her business for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a sack of potatoes, fish, a box of chicken, a bottle of vegetable oil, a sack of salt, tomato sauce and plastic bags.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila, 42 years of age, is married to a tricycle (motorcycle) driver and blessed with three children. 

She's been in the business of selling used clothes in their village for almost two years and is earning a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. Her net income is usually spent on their food expenses and school allowances of their children. Due to lack of capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase used clothes to sell. 

She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve and expand her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth is married with two children. Jeaneth is 26 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin, Philippines.

Jeaneth sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,500 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Jeaneth has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Jeaneth hope to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat is 52 years old and is a widowed mother of four children. To make a living, she has been selling Khmer Noodle for 32 years. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day but she can save about 14,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Nat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. Nat is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to make more crops to sell for a good price to make her family’s living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
At the age of 47 years, Thol is a married mother of five children living in the Borseth district of Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice while her husband is a carpenter. Having been in this business 29 years, she can earn about US$10 per day. 
Thol is with VisionFund just for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son to study at a university. She hopes this loan will enable him to stay in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to send her son to study at a university

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет 43 года. Совместно с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. В 2005 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле обувью, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 25,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Бермет имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли увеличить товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Бермет планирует вложить в обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Bermet is 43 years old. Together with her husband, she is raising three children. In 2005, the couple started their business of selling shoes. They started this business with initial start-up capital in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS). Having been able to develop her business and attract loyal customers, Bermet has an average monthly income of 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to the hard work put into their business, the couple has been able to increase their sales turnover. For the purpose of further increasing and expanding her business, Bermet turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan to increase her sales turnover. Bermet plans to invest the earnings from the loan in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale for future retail sale.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a 31-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from two to eight years old. She describes herself to be spiritual. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. Her business is located in a slum and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio como músico guitarrista desde hace más de 05 años, es conocido en su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una guitarra y pedalera para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Roy is 28 and lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayaltí, a community involved in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. He has been working as a guitarist  for 5 years, and is well known in his district. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy a guitar and guitar pedal to offer a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a guitar and guitar pedal.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is 24 years old and single. Due to lack of job opportunities, she engages herself in buying and selling dressed chicken, frozen foods and vegetables within her community. She operates her motorcycle transport to sell these products. She plans to further improve the business and increase her income, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of these products to sell. She believes that her loan will help her to further improve the business

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dressed chicken, frozen foods and vegetables to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 57, is married and lives in Dullan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philipiines.

From her desire to help the family, she engaged in dried fish vending starting up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. It has operated for 9 years already. Now, she is planning to borrow  PHP 14,900 from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2011. She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish. 

Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 28 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with 2 dependent children. 

Joel has been engaged in a gravel quarrying and supplying activity for 6 years already and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional construction materials for house repair. Joel has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. 

In the future, Joel hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en:
Marizel is 40 years old, separated and a resident of Aguada, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. Starting with capital of 7,000 PHP, she opened a small restaurant and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in February 2011 and has taken out previous loans. 

Recently, she applied for another loan to buy raw ingredients for her restaurant business. She wishes to maintain her membership in good standing and be able to manage her finances. If not for PMPC, she might not have any savings for future needs. Marizel only wants to live a happy and comfortable life and be able to help her nieces and nephews in their college education obligations.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Kiairungu Group

texts.en:
Joana is a member of Kiairungu self-help group which is in the central region of Kenya. He has 4 children and has been a farmer for 20 years. 

His primary source of income is from milk, eggs, tea, crops, and he also offers transport services. He enjoys being a farmer because of the diverse income sources. His biggest challenge is getting labor to help with the work on his farm. He chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer the opportunity to do savings. From Juhudi's training sessions Joana has learned how best to manage his loan. 

This loan will help his family purchase a d.light solar lantern which will save a lot of money that was previously used to buy kerosene.

loans.use: to purchase solar lighting

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.en:
Moses, age 35, is married with three children, two of whom go to school. Moses works as a booking officer for Ubumwe Bus Company and he realized the earnings he was getting are not enough to look after his family and pay school fees for his children. He saved some money and in 2010, he begun a retail shop business mostly dealing in the sale of soft drinks, which he believes is doing well. He hopes to retire from his job to concentrate on the business with his wife. 

Moses approached UGAFODE for a loan of 500,000 shillings to add stock in his shop. The customers and neighbors describe Moses as hard working and focused

loans.use: To buy retail stock and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives with her husband and three children. Her elder son is an army officer and her daughter works at a coal village school. Anna herself has been running a farm with the help of her husband. They keep livestock (3 cows, 35 sheep, 2 pigs, chickens and one colony of bees) and also cultivate wheat barley and potato. In the orchard which they own, Anna also grows apple and cherry trees. A big farm like this needs everyday care and work, therefore Anna and her husband work hard to run it in a sustainable way, ensuring stable income during the month. 
Anna has now applied for this loan to be able to enrich her livestock with 3 more calves. 
She also plans to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and will hope that lenders will help her to make her farm more sustainable.

loans.use: to pay for 3 calves and feed for the livestock

loans.name: Ma

texts.en:
Ma, 44, lives in Rohatil village in the region of Bakan district with her husband and three children. To meet the needs of her family, Ma runs a farm to grow rice and other seasonal crops for sale. Her husband and children are her labor force, helping her manage their farm. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is able to earn well for her family.

Ma would like to acquire a loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Ma is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 56 years old, and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now adult and school age.  Rebecca has a little store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell. Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000. This loan is intended to purchase raw ingredients and materials for her food processing business.

Marissa dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and materials for her food processing business

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a married woman and a mother of three grown up children from Panglao, Bohol. She has engaged in the fish vending business for more than 30 years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Prudencia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell. 

Prudencia hopes of making their business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty is 53 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. To make a living, Liberty is earning income from her meat vending business. She is earning approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase an additional three heads of pigs to butcher and resell.  Liberty has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Liberty hopes to expand her business to other municipalities.

loans.use: To purchase three heads of pigs to butcher and sell

loans.name: Marne Glides

texts.es:
Marne Glides tiene 54 años de edad, vive con esposo, en el distrito de Oyotún , una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, cuyes y gallinas desde hace cuatro años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marne Glides is 54 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Oyotún, a community whose residents dedicate themselves to agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She earns her living breeding and selling animals including ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. She has done this work for 4 years. She is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian soles for the purchase of feed to fatten her animals and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Djuzumkan

texts.ru: Джузумкан 55 лет, замужем. У Джузумкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Джузумкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Джузумкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 2 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Джузумкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Джузумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Djuzumkan is 55 years old and married. Djuzumkan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Djuzumkan practices livestock breeding. She started this business 23 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Djuzumkan's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 1 horse and 2 calves on her farm. Her monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS). Djuzumkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Djuzumkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es:
La  joven  Lesly  Carmina de 28  años de edad vive con su esposa, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 04  años  al trabajo de contadora en una casa comercial.
Lesly  el crédito que solicita es para mejorar su casa ya que desea ampliar la cocina y desea demoler la pila que está adentro de su casa y trasladarla afuera y necesita  para Comprar el cemento, ladrillo, arena y pagar la mano de obra. Con el apoyo del crédito ella pretende mejorar mas su calidad de vida es un cliente nuevo.
 Su sueño es mejorar su casa.
 San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Lesly Carmina is 28 and lives with her husband. She doesn't have dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has her own house and has been working for 4 years as an accountant in a trading house.

Lesly is a new borrower, and is asking for a loan to improve her house. She wants to widen the kitchen and demolish the sink and move it outside. She needs the loan to buy cement, bricks and sand, as well as to pay workers. With the support of the loan she hopes to improve her quality of life. Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2014.

loans.use: to buy items such as cement, bricks and sand for her house.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros, age 64, has been growing rice for over 30 years. He sells his products in the areas surrounding Kampong Cham province. With the income earned from farming, he manages to cover the household expenses and sends some of his children to be educated in school. He currently lives with his wife and children in his own house located in Batheay district, Kampong Cham province.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline to improve the productivity of his farm. In the future, he aims to improve the land where he grows his crops as it is the sole source of his income. 

Thanks to all lenders for their loan help which is a great support to allow Ros to manage his farm productively.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline to improve the productivity of his farm.

loans.name: Kory Chuyma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY CHUYMA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: ayudante de mecánica, venta der mantas, restaurant, elaboración de carteras, salón de eventos, joyería, venta de comida, venta de helados, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una prima que fue socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un poco capital que tenía y con un comercio básico.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito que le ofrece la institución.

Al grupo acompaña el esposo de una de las socias, ekl esta vestido con una chopa blanca
texts.en:
The Kory Chuyma communal bank will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office. The group has nine members. It is lead by an executive board where Verónica is the treasurer. The members of the communal bank are involved in a variety of businesses including: mechanic's assistant, blanket vendor, restaurant owner, purse designer, event hall, jewelry, food vendor, ice cream vendor and cosmetics vendor. 

This loan benefits the small micro entrepreneurs  group where Verónica is a member. She mentions that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. She mentions that the business started with a little capital she had and a basic store. 

The loan will be used to increase capital ( the wholesale purchase of rice and noodles) which she will purchase at the markets in the city of El Alto. After the preparations, she will sells the products in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family since she lives with her spouse and she has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training and the loans that the institution offers. 

The group is accompanied by the husband of one of the members. He is wearing the white jacket.

loans.use: purchase wholesale rice and noodles.

loans.name: Guljan

texts.ru: Гулжан 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулжан - среднее образование, вместе с мужем Гулжан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 35,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату обучения детей в высших учебных заведениях.
texts.en: Guljan is 29 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Guljan has a secondary education. Guljan and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 6 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Guljan's hard work, she currently has 2 horses on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). She also cultivates a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows beans. The gathered harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Guljan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. After purchasing the cattle, they will be located on her farm. In the summer, they will be under the care of a shepherd. Guljan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to pay for her children's higher education tuition.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 76 years old, married and a resident of Dullan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She earns a living through dried fish selling. Gertrudes has been in the business for 20 years already and it's going well.

She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more kilos and more varieties of dried fish to sell.

Gertrudes deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos and more varieties of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru: Игорь торгует  мужской обувью. Основной бизнес у него на выезде, в ближайших населенных пунктах. При этом Игорь имеет одну торговую точку и на рынке в городе, где работает продавец. Сам Игорь ездит на своем микроавтобусе и продает обувь прямо с машины.  У него много постоянных покупателей. Умеренные цены на обувь также привлекают клиентов. Игорь просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 40,000 гривен на закупку весенней мужской обуви. Он планирует увеличить товарооборот и получить дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en: Igor sells men's shoes. His core business is done on the road, in neighboring towns and villages. That being said, Igor also has one market stall at the city market, where he works as a salesperson. Igor transports himself in his own minibus and sells shoes right out of his car. He has many loyal customers. His fair shoe prices also attract customers. Igor is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy men's shoes for spring. He plans to increase his sales turnover and receive an additional profit.

loans.use: to purchase men's spring shoes for retail sale.

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
Williams tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, cuna comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y llantas para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wiliams is 21 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district. It is a community dedicated to farming, business and raising livestock located in the Chiclayo province which is in the Lambayeque region on the northern cost of Perú. 

He offers public transportation service in his own mototaxi, shuttling his passengers to villages neighboring his district. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase spare parts and tires for his vehicle. With these items, he can continue offering this service to his customers.

loans.use: purchase spare parts and tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 28 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with 2 dependent children. Rey has been engaged in operating a motorcab for hire for 2 years already and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 3 piglets, 5 sacks of feed, and vitamins for his hog raising activity as an alternative income. 

Rey has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Rey hopes to expand his hog raising activity.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing 3 piglets, 5 sacks of feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 

Norma has been engaged in business buying and selling dried fish, cosmetics, and RTWs (ready-to-wear clothing) for 2 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She is also supported by her husband, who is a carpenter. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of dried fish, cosmetics, and RTWs. Part of the net proceeds is also for paying the tuition fees of her daughter.  

Norma has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Norma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of dried fish, cosmetics, and RTWs

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 59 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children. 

Esterlita is engaged in a food production and selling business, particularly “cotchinta”-making, for 25 years already and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional kilos of rice, sugar, cheese, and other ingredients for her food production business.  

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Esterlita hopes to introduce her business to big supermarkets and stores.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional kilos of rice, sugar, cheese, and other ingredients

loans.name: Aladino

texts.es:
Aladino tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace 4 años en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aladino, age 52, lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district.  It is a community that devotes itself to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  It is located in the Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.

He and his wife have been raising and selling animals like roosters, hens, and chickens for four years.  They do this in the area behind their house.

He has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals.  This way he will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children and all her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She operates a restaurant on a retail basis at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 4 years. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy rice, flour, sugar, and bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspirations are to buy a fridge and educate her children to the university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rice, flour, sugar, and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: De Sol A Sol Group

texts.es: Coordinado por la señora Rosa con 24 años de edad y casada vende ropa nueva en el mercado municipal para adultos y niños, tiene 4 años de poseer el negocio, su principal ayuda son dos trabajadoras que les paga salario, piensa invertir en más mercadería para surtir su negocio como es pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, camisas de damas, shores, blusas etc. también el grupo está  integrado por el  socio Hugo con 28 años de edad el cual vende ropa de manera ambulante en el municipio, y la socia María que se dedica a la vende ropa nueva en el mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Rosa is 24, married and is the group's co-ordinator. She sells new children's and adults' clothes at the town market. She has managed her business for 4 years, and her principal help comes from two female workers, whom she pays a regular salary. She plans to invest in more goods to stock her business, such as men's and ladies' trousers and shirts, shorts and blouses.

Hugo is another member of the group and is 28 years old. He sells clothes in the town as a street vendor. María is another member, and she sells new clothing at the town market.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as ladies' and men's trousers and shirts, shorts and blouses.

loans.name: Musavvara

texts.ru: Мусаввара опытная портниха, ей 28 лет. Она проживает в городе Истаравшан с сыном, дочерью и матерью. Мусаввара в течение трех лет предоставляет услуги швеи. Она берет заказы на пошив женских национальных платьев. Она с интересом относится к своей работе, так как она любит кроить и шить. Одновременно Мусаввара еще и учится в университете. Она успешно совмещает работу с учебой. Мусаввара обратилась за кредитом с целью расширения своей деятельности. Она хочет купить еще одну вышивальную машинку, на которой она будет делать вышивки на платьях. Этот кредит ей важен для увеличения бюджета семьи.
texts.en:
Musavvara is 28 years old and an experienced seamstress. She lives in the city of Istaravshan with her son, daughter and mother. For the last three years, Musavvara has been working as a seamstress. She works on commission to sew women's national dresses. She is interested in her work, as she loves to mend and sew.

At the same time, Musavvara is still studying at the university and she successfully combines her work with her studies. Musavvara has asked for a loan with the goal of expanding her business. She wants to buy another sewing machine that she can use to embroider embellishments on her dresses. This loan is very important to the improvement of her family budget.

loans.use: to buy one more sewing machine so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en: Arceli, 50-years-old, is widowed and has two children. She has had a retailing business for almost seven years. Her income from her business is usually spent on their daily expenses, electric bills, and food expenses. Due to having inadequate capital to run her business, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase food products, grocery items, breads, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and be more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase food products, grocery items, bread and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is 44-years-old and lives in Salvador, Calamba. He is married with three children.  He has been gardening for five years and earns a monthly income of Php 6,000.00 from this kind of work.  He joined Kiva partner Paglaum last May 2012, and applied for a loan  to buy fertilizer and garden materials.  The profits he earns in his garden are used for savings and tuition fees for his three children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and garden materials.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is married to a carpenter.  She has been weaving and selling lampakanay products in town to make a living.  She also sells to some walk in costumers. Her income helps a lot to support her three children's education. Her income from this business plays a good role for their household expenditures. To improve sales, she borrowed a loan from Kiva partner GDMPC micro credit in order to buy woven lampakanay to sell. She sells her products in town to gain more income. In the future, she wants to improve her business as well as the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy woven lampakanay to sell

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda has been running a general store for a living. Her husband is a farmer and she has three children. Farming is their main source of income and she earns income from her store, too. She has been operating her business for fifteen years. 

To improve sales, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional groceries and beverages to sell. In the future, she wants to improve their farm as well as her business to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Grace is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Grace has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Grace has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru: Ирина в разводе. Она живет с младшим сыном и занимается бизнесом. Ирина продает женскую одежду и обувь на выездной торговле. У нее есть микроавтобус, на котором она ездит по близним населенным пунктам и продает товар. Также Ирина сама ездит на закупку товара в Одессу 2-3 раза в месяц. Ирина имеет достаточный опыт торговли, доступный ходовой товар, постоянных клиентов и померную цену. Ирина просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки женской весенней одежды и обуви. Ирина планирует заработать дополнительную прибыль улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en: Irina is divorced. She lives with her youngest son and is a businesswoman. Irina sells women's clothing and shoes through traveling sales. She has a minibus which she uses to travel to neighboring towns and villages and sell her merchandise. Irina also goes to Odessa 2 to 3 times per month to buy merchandise. Irina has enough sale experience, very fast-selling merchandise, loyal customers and reasonable prices. Irina is requesting a loan to buy women's spring clothing and shoes. Irina plans to earn additional profits in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing and shoes for retail sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 22-year-old woman with two children. She runs a small business selling barbequed food in her community to earn a living, and she has been doing this for many years. 

Mary has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a bottle of mushroom soya, tomato sauce, a box of sausage, taro, plastic bags, plates and aluminum foil to help her to run the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Mary will use her profits to help her children and family everyday needs and hopes to begin a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a bottle of mushroom soya, tomato sauce, a box of sausage, taro, plastic bags, plates and aluminum foil.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (mother). She sells sweet bananas on a retail basis at the market. She works for seven days a week. She has been in business for the last seven years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACC0 in order to buy bunches of sweet bananas. Her major business challenges includes transportation and seasonality .Her goal and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and educate her children  up to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and 2 of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. 

She sells green bananas and charcoal on a retail basis at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last 4 years. She has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags and bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenge includes transportation and seasonality .

Her goal and aspirations are to become a wholesaler, start going to villages of Masaka for green bananas, and also to educate her children to the university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Duhuze Group

texts.fr:
Samuel fait partie du groupe  Duhuze  et habite à  Ngozi. Il a 36 ans et est marié  à  Séraphine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,  âgés de 2  à 10 ans, dont 1 étudie.
  
Il fait le commerce de  vaches et de chèvres depuis 15  ans. 

Il  est à son treizième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  8 chèvres  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dan les années prochaines, il voudrait acheter un terrain cultivable et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Samuel is part of the group Duhuze and lives in Ngozi. He is 36 years old and married to Séraphine, a farmer. Together they have four children, from 2 to 10 years old, of whom one is a student. 

Samuel has been doing commerce in cows and goats for fifteen years. 

This is his 13th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase 8 goats to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a plot of arable land and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase goats to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Shining Miracle Group

texts.en: Rose, a member of Shining Miracle self help group ,lives in Murang'a area which is situated near Nairobi. She has two children and has been a smallholder farmer for eight years. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, tea, crops and transportation services. She enjoys making money from selling produce from her farm. Her biggest challenge is the high cost of labor. Her cow goes by the name of Mwiru. She has learned from Juhudi that loans can improve the living standards of farmers when they are invested well. This loan is going to help her family purchase an a d.light lamp which will save some money from reduced use of Kerosene to light her home.

loans.use: to purchase solar lighting.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. Rosa is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rosa requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional box of fish to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for 32 years now.

Rosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Amelan

texts.en:
Amelan is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Amelan is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase adsditional sacks of feeds for her pig.

Amelan has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase adsditional sacks of feeds for her pig

loans.name: Kalerwe Tulla- Habib Group

texts.en:
Yunus and his group thank the group of Kiva lenders for helping them buy a taxi previously. This has helped them earn income.

Yunus drives a taxi to earn a living. He started this job in 2003 after failing to find formal employment, and yet still having to meet the growing needs of his family. Yunus mainly deals in town service transportation.

Yunus acquired a loan in a group to purchase a taxi. However, he re-approached Ugafode for a add-on loan to pay tuition for his children at school. Yunus is a very hardworking and social gentleman.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 43 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Conchita is engaged in a food production and selling business particularly viand making for four years already and earns approximately PHP 1,300 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional kilos of meat, vegetables, spices and seasoning for her food production business.  

Conchita has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, Conchita hopes to build an eatery for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional kilos of meat, vegetables, spices and seasoning

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 34-year-old married woman. She has only one child who is attending school. Sina describes herself to be a small person but hardworking. She operates a farm where she grows rice in the two seasons of the year. She has been involved in this business for nearly 15 years. Her business is located in a good area of the Prey Veng province and is going well.

As this will be her first loan, Sina will use it to buy a solar home system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After being with Hattha Kaksekar Limited, she can gain access to micro-finance services and solar energy, which she will use to support household appliances such as lights, TV, and radio, so everyone in her family can work or even study at night. 

She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system to install on the top roof of her house

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 31 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 

Myrna is engaged in a food production business particularly roasted bananas, hotdogs and barbecue cooking earning approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. 

Myrna has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional kilos of hotdogs, meats and bananas for her food production business.  Myrna became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her stall for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of hotdogs, meat and bananas

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom in school, Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, can goods, chips, etc.

Grace has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, can goods, chips, etc

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Victoria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional box of fish to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years. Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetable and spices to sell for her buy and sell vegetables and spices business.

Riza has been in this business for 6 years. Riza earns more income from fish vending and pig fattening.

Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetable and spices to sell

loans.name: Luiza

texts.ru:
Луиза торгует детскими игрушками. Она уже пользовалась КИВА кредитами раньше. Благодаря последнему кредиту Луиза смогла отремонтировать свой киоск и сделать его более привлекательным для поукпателей.

Луиза торгует уже 19 лет. Луизе нравится работать с данным товаром и она хотела бы и в дальнейшем развивать свой бизнес, получив дополнительную прибыль от продаж. Луиза просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки партии детских игрушек. В ее планах - открытие второй торговой точки.
texts.en:
Luiza sells children's toys. She has used a KIVA loan before. Thanks to her last loan, Luiza was able to renovate her kiosk and make it more enticing to customers.

Luiza has been in the sales business for 19 years already. Luiza likes working with her current merchandise and would like to further develop her business and receive additional profits from the sales. Luiza is requesting a loan to buy a shipment of children's games. She plans to open a second store.

loans.use: to purchase children's toys for retail sale.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. Luciana is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like biscuits and snack foods, candies, personal care materials, coffee and sugar and others. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus, attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Luciana hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 37 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents.
 
Estela has a little store and sells groceries and other consumable products earning approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Estela became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Estela hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Lourlyn

texts.en:
Lourlyn works hard to support her family. Lourlyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lourlyn requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Lourlyn has been in this business for 4 years now.

Lourlyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 61 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like can goods,, egg, milk, sugar, noodles, etc..

Evelyn has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like can goods,, egg, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en:
Arevhat lives in Lernantsq village with her two daughters. She is a farmer with 15 years of experience running a farm. She keeps livestock (a cow, three sheep, pig and chickens) and also cultivates wheat and potatoes. Near the house where Arevhat lives she also runs a small general store where she trades with different types of basic goods. 

Arevhat is a very hard working and enthusiastic woman who does her best to provide appropriate living conditions for her daughters. By requesting this loan of USD 1500 Arevhat would like to enlarge her farm. She will use the loan to purchase an ox, four piglets, forage for the livestock and seeds for land cultivation. Realizing how important agricultural income for her family is, Arevhat will be very thankful if lenders support her.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, four piglets, forage for the livestock and seeds for land cultivation.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr: Samuel est un jeune homme de 33ans célibataire il na aucun enfant a sa charge juste sa famille ce qui sous entend(parents frère et sœur à sa charge)il exerce un petit commerce dans un marché de la cité capital il l'exerce aujourd'hui depuis 1 ans. son objectif ici c'est de faire grandir son commerce ce pour cette effet qu'il a sérieusement besoin d'un appuis financière pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande de sa clientèles qui devient de plus en plus grande, avoir la capacité de prendre soins de sa famille sans plus toute fois rencontrai des difficulté
texts.en: Samuel is a young man, 33-year-old, unmarried, and without children to support, just his family, which is understood (parents, brothers, and sisters to support). He has been operating a small business at a downtown market for a year now. His goal is to expand his business, so he has a serious need for financial support to be able to meet the demands of his customer base, which is becoming larger and larger. He also has a need to be able to take care of his family without ever encountering any more difficulties.

loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Virgie works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Virgie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetables stall for her vegetables vending business.

Virgie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetables stall

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 46 years old and married with six children, two of whom in college.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, can goods, egg, spices, bread, shampoo, etc.

Bernadita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buy and sell charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, can goods, egg, spices, bread, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru: Игорь работает механиком на железной дороге. Проживает в своем доме вместе с женой, сыном и своим отцом. Дом Игоря достался ему в наследство, он уже старенький. Внешний слой штукатури осыпается и есть опасность разрушения стены дома. Игорь просит предоставить ему кредит для ремонта дома. Он хочет нанести слой декоративной штукатурки на наружные стены, что сделает их не только красивыми, но и влагоустойчивыми. Ремонт Игорь планирует делать сам, что съэкономит средства. Любимое увлечение Игоря - рыбалка.
texts.en: Igor works as a mechanic for the railroad. He lives in his house with his wife, son and father. Igor's house was given to him through inheritance - it's already very old. The outer layer of plaster is crumbling and there is a danger that the walls of the house will collapse. Igor is requesting a loan to repair his house. He wants to apply a layer of decorative plaster on the exterior walls to make them not only beautiful but also moisture-resistant. Igor plans to do these repairs himself to save on money. Igor's favorite hobby is fishing.

loans.use: to fix the exterior of his house.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 51 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Aida is engaged in salted fish fry production and selling business for two years already earning approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional kilos of fish fry for her salted fry production.  

Aida has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Aida hopes to expand her business to other municipalities.

loans.use: To purchase additional kilos of fish fry for her salted fish fry production

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a hardware shop at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last six years. She gets additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy nails, hoes and tins of paint.  Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves  and seasonality.  Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more nails, tins of paint, hoes and cement

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, noodles, soap, etc for her general store business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, noodles, soap, etc

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Miljury

texts.en:
Miljury is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Miljury is 40 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Miljury has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Miljury requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

Miljury has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Miljury would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is 44 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Desiree is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Desiree has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Tuendeleye Group

texts.fr: La cliente Madama  est  membre  de l’association de crédit Tuendelee.  Agée de 53 ans, elle est  mère de 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école et mariée à un homme d’affaire.  Commerçante de longue date, elle commença les activités de commerce grâce au fonds reçu de son mari. Elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter  30 pièces de pagnes africains. Ainsi, elle rêve devenir grossiste en s’approvisionnant à partir de l’usine. Enfin, elle remercie fortement Hekima.
texts.en:
The client, Madama, is a member of the Tuendelee loan group. She is 53 years old, married to a businessman, and has three children who all go to school. She has been a merchant for a long time, and started her business with funds from her husband. 

She is asking for this new loan to buy 30 African pagnes (traditional wraparounds). She would like to become a wholesaler and buy her supplies at the factory. She is very thankful for Hekima.

loans.use: buy 30 African pagnes (traditional wraparounds).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy upholstery materials like thread, canvas, plywood etc.

loans.name: Aisa

texts.en:
Aisa is 34 years old and married with two children,one of whom in school, Aisa works very hard to provide for them.

Aisa runs a buy and sell cultured pearl in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Aisa has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 42 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can gods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

Aida has borrowed and paid 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell bamboo.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can gods, egg, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Union Fait La Force Group

texts.fr: Le Client Katvasi est un commerçant d’une expérience de 7 ans, âgée de 30 ans, célibataire, président et membre d’un collectif d’Affaires « Union fait la force».
