Il est vendeur de divers articles. Il installe ses marchandises  dans un magasin de la ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 24 pièces de valises et sacs au dos. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de ses parents. Dans le travail, il s’entraide avec sa mère. Dans l’avenir, il souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux  entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment de  post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Katvasi, is a merchant with seven years of experience. He is 30 years old, unmarried, and the president of a business collective called "Union fait la force" [strength in unity]. He is a vendor of a variety of goods. He sets up his merchandise in a store in town. 

He is requesting a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima to increase his business by purchasing 24 pieces of luggage and backpacks. He had started his business with funds from his parents. In his work, he and his mother assist one another. For the future, he would like to increase his credit and to provide education and food for his children. 

He thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs by granting them microloans during this time of post-conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase 24 pieces of luggage and backpacks

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and married with two children.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, detergent soap, sugar, coffee, juice, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Maricel has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Maricel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, detergent soap, sugar, coffee, juice, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 66 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 14500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetable, meat, spices, milk, etc.

Violeta has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetable, meat, spices, milk, etc

loans.name: Nestor Antonio

texts.es: Don Néstor es originario de la ciudad de Estelí,  soltero. Tiene 32 años de edad. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de enderezado y pintura. Inicio aprendiendo del trabajo que realizaban sus compañeros y poco a poco fue ahorrando y logro comprar su propia máquina fue así como comenzó su propio negocio. Su meta próxima es mejorar su negocio y crecer como empresario. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Zinc, Soldadura, Pintura, Thenner entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es incrementar el tamaño de su negocio.
texts.en: Néstor is from the city of Estelí and is single. He is 32 years old. He makes a living by providing the services of metal straightening and painting. He started learning this work that his friends did, and little by little he saved up and managed to buy his own machine. This was how he started his own business. His immediate goal is to improve his business and to grow as a businessman. He is asking for the loan to buy zinc, welding materials, paint and paint thinner, among other products. He thinks that the loan will be a lot of help to him, as he will be able to meet his customer's demands. His future plan is to increase the size of his business.

loans.use: to buy zinc, welding materials, paint and paint thinner, among other products

loans.name: Memoracion

texts.en: Memoracion, 60-years-old, is still single. She's harmoniously residing in her village together with her parents. Memoracion has had a tailoring business for almost fifteen years and earns a net income of PHP 1,800 weekly. Her net income is usually spent on her daily expenditures and on medications for her parents. Due to inadequate capital for her business, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase garments, threads, needles, zippers and garters to use in her tailoring shop. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase garments, threads, needles, zippers and garters to use in her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa is 38 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Marissa has a general store business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marissa has been in this business for 1 year. Marissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming flowers in the Philippines. Candida is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other flowering plant seeds.

Candida has been farming flowers  for 10 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other flowering plant seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies to help grow her coffee crops.

loans.name: Tulindane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nsimire est vice-présidente de l’association d’affaire Tulindane. Femme  entrepreneur, elle est âgée de 43 ans et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient. Son conjoint est un vétérinaire de la place. La cliente est vendeuse de matelas au marché central depuis plus de 4ans. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira d’acheter 9 matelas d’épaisseur 15. Son objectif principal c’est la croissance  de son entreprise. Au final, elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en: This client, Nsimire, is the vice-president of the business association "Tulindane". A woman entrepreneur, she is 43 years old and the mother of eight children, who are students. Her husband is a local veterinarian. This client has been a vendor of mattresses at the central market for over four years. This new loan will be used to purchase 9 mattresses of thickness 15. Her main goal is growth in her enterprise. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to purchase 9 mattresses

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru: Ирина торгует женской одеждой на рынке. Проживает вместе с сыном и мужем в доме вместе с родителями мужа. Дом имеет два этажа и Ирина с мужем и сыном живет на втором этаже в одной комнате. Они хотят отремотнировать вторую имеющуюся комнату, где нет отделки. Ирина просит предоставить ей кредит на ремонт комнаты - сделать электрику, стены, пол, утепление, потолок. Ремонт комнаты поможет Ирине расширить жилую площадь и улучшить условия проживания своей семьи.
texts.en: Irina sells women's clothing at the market. She lives with her son, her husband and her husband's parents in one house. The house has two stories. Irina, her husband and her son all live on the second story in one room. They want to renovate the second available room which has not been finished. Irina is requesting a loan to repair this room - to do the electrical wiring, walls, floor, heating and ceiling. Repairing the room will help Irina expand her living space and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to completely repair one room in her house.

loans.name: Chaguma Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwanvuwa est membre  du groupe d’affaire Chaguma.  Expérimentée dans le commerce, elle debuta ses activités à partir de son fonds propre.  Elle est âgée de 36 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse de sucre depuis plusieurs années et  installe sa marchandise au marché public. Ce nouveau prêt va lui permettre l’accroissement de son capital en achetant 1 sac de 25kg de sucre. Ainsi, elle souhaite évoluer dans ses activités et devenir grossiste. Enfin, elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: This client, Mwanvuwa, is a member of the business group "Chaguma". Experienced in commerce, she started her business with her own funds. She is 36 years old and the mother of four children, who are all students. This client has been a vendor of sugar for several years. She sets up her merchandise at the public market. This new loan will enable her to grow her capital through the purchase of a 25-kg sack of sugar. Thus, she would like to advance in her business and become a wholesaler. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase a 25-kg sack of sugar

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 49 years old and married with six children, five of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Marissa has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Marissa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, bread, soft drinks etc. to sell for her general store business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, bread, soft drinks etc. to sell

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly works hard to support her family. Kimberly is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Kimberly has been in this business for 2 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, chips, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Juan Pastor

texts.es: Juan tiene 34 años de edad   nos comenta que cuando tenía 6 meses de nacido su familia se fue a vivir fuera de Nicaragua   ya que en ese tiempo había problemas de la guerra reclutamiento y otros factores después  diez años más tarde regresaron  y  se establecieron  nuevamente  en la comunidad  del guapinol  ahí comenzó estudio su primaria y secundaria  llego hasta segundo año de secundaria , después  decidió ingresar  a un ministerio cristiano  actualmente es pastor  de  iglesia  Zareth  en la comarca de mina el limón tiene  40 miembros en la iglesia . Hace cuatro años se casó  y tiene un hijo de 2 años, él vive en la casa pastoral de la iglesia, como en la comunidad no hay luz eléctrica él quiere hacer este préstamo para comprar un sistema solar y instalarlo  en la casa pastoral el cual le serviría también para pasarle luz a la iglesia y en la noches poder hacer reuniones y cultos con sus miembros.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old. He comments that he was 6 months old when his family left Nicaragua to live elsewhere. At this time there was a recruitment going on for the war and other negative factors. Ten years later they returned and re-established themselves in the community of Guapinol. He started school here and went up to his second year of Secondary school. Then he decided to enter into a Christian ministry. Today he is the minister of the Zareth Church in the Mina el Limón district. There are 40 members in the congregation. 

Four years ago he got married and has a two year old son. He lives in the parsonage. As there is no electricity in the community he would like a loan to buy a solar system and install it in the pastoral house. He could also use it to transfer light to the church and have evening meetings and services for his members.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Sabiana

texts.en:
Sabiana works hard to support her family. Sabiana is married and has a coconut vending business in the Philippines.

Sabiana requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell.

Sabiana has been in this business for 3 years now.

Sabiana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья замужем. У нее есть дочь. Их небольшая семья проживает в городе Павлограде. Наталья имеет собственный бизнес.

Наталья продает женские пальто, куртки. Торговая точка расположена в удачном месте. Занимается Наталья этим  делом более 8 лет. Она трудолюбива. Наталья также вежлива по отношению к клиентам.  Доход ее бизнеса играет большую роль в бюджете семьи. 

Наталья уже прользовалася КИВА кредитами. Она считает их выгодными для своего бизнеса. Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту Наталья смогла вовремя приобрести необходимы товар и в результате получить дополнительную прибыль для своей семьи.

В этот раз Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 40,000 гривен на приобретение новых пальто и курточек к весеннему сезону.
texts.en:
Nataliya is married. She has a daughter. Her small family lives in the city of Pavlograd. Nataliya has her own business.

Nataliya sells women's coats and jackets. Her shop is located in a favorable location. Nataliya has been in this business for more than 8 years. She is a hardworking woman. Nataliya is also courteous to her customers. The revenue from this business plays a big role in her family's budget.

Nataliya has already used KIVA loans. She considers them beneficial to her business. Thanks to her last KIVA loan, Nataliya was able to buy necessary merchandise on time and, as a result, received additional revenue for her family.

This time, Nataliya is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy new coats and jackets for the spring season.

loans.use: to buy new coats and jackets for the spring season.

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “27 DE MAYO” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Petrona es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de prendas de vestir, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, venta de mochilas, venta de golosinas, servicio de transporte, bordado de ropa de moreno.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Petrona es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió posterior a su matrimonio, ya que necesitaba generar recursos económicos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de maíz y carne por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella está casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le las capacitaciones en crédito y salud que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta una señora acompañando al grupo, ella esta en la parte de atras, vestida con una chompa blanca
texts.en:
The "27 DE MAYO" communal association will start its thirteenth cycle at Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It has eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Petrona is the President. The members of the communal association have a variety of businesses, including sewing clothing, selling vegetables, selling clothing, selling backpacks, selling candy, a transport service and embroidering traditional clothing.

The loan they will take out will benefit a group of small business owners, of which Petrona is a member. She says that this is the third cycle she has participated in at Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of her friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling food; she says that she started this business after her marriage, as she needed to generate financial resources.

The loan she is currently taking out is for an increase in capital (to buy corn and meat wholesale), which she will acquire from the distributors of the city of El Alto. After cooking, she sells the food in her sales post. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family, as she is married and has two children.  

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training on credit and health that the institution offers.

In the picture she is a woman accompanied by the group; she is in the back, dressed in a white sweater.

loans.use: to buy corn and meat wholesale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, noodles,etc.

Helen has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Helen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, noodles,etc

loans.name: Nerly

texts.en:
Nerly is 23 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell cultured pearl in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of cultures pearl to sell.

Nerly has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell cultured pearl for 2 years and also earns an income from general store.

Nerly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cultures pearl to sell

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en:
Servilla is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Servilla is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Servilla has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Servilla requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like pants, curtains, blouses, etc. to sell.

Servilla has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Servilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods like pants, curtains, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Roxanne works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice and charcoal. Roxanne is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business.

Roxanne has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is from Lernantsq village, where she lives with her husband and 2 children. Her husband drives a taxi using his own car and Hermine takes care of the farm. 

Hermine keeps livestock (2 cows, 26 sheep, calves, and chickens) and cultivates wheat and potatoes. Hermine also keeps a small orchard where she grows some fruit trees (plums, nuts, apples, and pears).

Over 15 years of hard work, Hermine's farm is now sustainable enough and the income from agriculture is an important part of the family's living. She asks for this loan of USD 1,500 to be able to purchase forage to feed the livestock and make previous credit payments. As the arable land that Hermine owns is not big, she is not able to cultivate grass as forage for the livestock. The loan will greatly help Hermine and she hopes for lenders' support.

She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Hermine has been approved for this loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed the livestock and make previous credit payments

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of three additional family members. 

She operates a pub on a retail basis at the market; she works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 15 years. She also gets additional income from selling fire wood. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a jerycan of local brew, spirits, soda, and crates of beer. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a flat screen television set for her bar. 

Jane lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more jerycans of local brew, spirits, soda, and crates of beer for her pub

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, chips, can goods, egg, noodles, etc.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 years and also earns an income from buy and sell charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, chips, can goods, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Ascion

texts.en:
Ascion is 38 years old and married with two children who are in school, Ascion works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell.

Ascion has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Ascion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Kalerwe Tulla Tda- Godfrey Group

texts.en:
For many years, Godfrey had been driving employed by Yasin, the owner of the taxi that he was driving previously. But with the help of Kiva lenders through UGAFODE and his group, Godfrey is now a proud owner of a taxi that he bought last year. He has, however, been in the process of repaying the loan so did not save enough money to pay the tuition for his children. 

Godfrey therefore needs a loan to pay school fees for his son, who has just joined secondary school. Godfrey will be very glad if his request is put into consideration because he really believes that educating his son is the best gift a parent can offer to a child. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for lending to the previous loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his son

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and married with two children who are in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Analyn is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Analyn has requested PHP 3000 loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Analynis committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Ella es Diana Marcela, tiene 20 años es la hija mayor de 3 hermanos, el anhelo es seguir estudiando para poder surgir profesionalmente y así poder realizarse como persona, el sueño es ser una persona profesional, poder trabajar y adquirir muchas cosas, una de ellas esta ayudarle a la mamá, ya que ella ha tenido que dejar muchas cosas para poder sacarlos adelante.
Quiere estudiar atención integral a la primera infancia ya que le gustan mucho los niños, quiere compartir con ellos el crecimiento, la forma de aprender, de entender las cosas, de demostrar el afecto, enseñarles a valorarse como persona, a respetar a los demás y valorarlos también, ya que esta etapa de la vida es muy importante para ellos y es el momento donde lo que uno les enseña es lo que se les queda grabado.
Los anhelos es poder brindarles a todos los niños amor cariño y que sientan en ella como  si estuvieran con la mama, que sientan ese cariño a demás de  los que les puede enseñar. 
El convenio de kiva seria una ayuda grande para ella, ya que al momento de realizar los pagos el valor que pagaría mensual seria un poco más económico, el dinero que ella se puede economizar lo puede utilizar en otros gastos que le genera el estudio.
texts.en:
This is Diana Marcela.  She's 20 and the oldest daughter out of of three siblings.  She has a strong desire to continue studying to develop rofessionally so she can fulfill herself as a person.  Her dream is to be able to work to achieve many things, to help her mother, for one, because she has had to give up so much so that they could get ahead.

Diana wants to focus her studies on early childhood because she really likes children.  She wants to share with them about growing up, about how to learn and understand things, and how to show affection.  She wants to teach them to value themselves as people and how to respect and value others.  This is a very important stage of life for them, the time when they'll retain what they've been taught.  

Diana yearns to bring love and affection to all children.  She wants them to feel as they would with their own mother, and wants everyone she teaches to feel that affection.  

The agreement with Kiva will be a big help for Diana.  Once the payments start coming in, her monthly expenditures will be lower, and the money she saves can be used to pay other school expenses.

loans.use: Para pagar un semestre de matricula

loans.name: Soberana Group

texts.es: Dirigido por la señora María con 38 años de edad, acompañada con 5 hijos, pero solamente tres dependen de ella de las edades de 16, 14, 7 años, diariamente vende  fritangas en su domicilio, quien le enseño y aprendió  a cocinar desde muy pequeña  su mamá ya que es muy reconocida en su comunidad, la comida es de muy buena calidad,  decidieron impulsar este negocio, venden enchiladas, tacos, maduro con queso, etc., siendo de principal ayuda la hija mayor.  El crédito lo invertía en la compra de materia prima como carne de res, carne de pollo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leña, verduras, plátano verde, plátano maduro, queso de crema, aceite por bidón etc. También está integrado por las socia Josefa de 37 años vende comida y refrescos naturales y por la socia Audelina la cual elabora zapatos y tiene  37 años de edad.
texts.en: The group is headed by the 38 year old Maria, who has five children, three of whom depend on her and are aged 7, 14, 16 years old. She learned to cook from her mother at a very young age, and sells fritangas out of her home on a daily basis. The food is of very high quality and is she is renowned in the community.  Her oldest daughter is the one who helps the most in this business they decided to get off the ground. They sell enchiladas, tacos, plantains with cheese, etc. She'll invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials such as beef, chicken, rice, beans, sugar, firewood, vegetables, green bananas, ripe bananas, cream cheese, containers of oil, etc. The group also includes members Josefa, a 37 year old woman who sells food and natural beverages, and Audelina, a 37 year old woman who makes shoes.

loans.use: To invest in beef, chicken, pork, ripe bananas, green bananas, rice, beans, containers of oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is a 26-year-old married woman from the village of Katskhi, in the Chiatura district. She lives with her husband, little son, and grandmother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. The family runs an agricultural activity. Particularly, Teona and her husband are engaged in cattle, sheep, and milked-cow breeding, as well as cultivating a plot of agricultural land. Teona sells milk products and sheep locally. However, income is insignificant for them to live with satisfying conditions and cover all expenses. 

In order to more effectively meet all daily costs, Teona wants to start other private activities and requested a loan. With the requested money, she plans to open a bakery near her house, purchase all the needed merchandise, and start baking traditional pastry dishes. It will be great support for this hard-working couple to generate more income and gain financial stability for their family. Teona awaits your kindness and will be grateful for your help.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a farmer who hails from the Kitale area of north rift Kenya, an area with high poultry and maize farming. She is married, has two children, and has been doing farming for two years where her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, maize, and beans. Her biggest challenges are lack of capital and lack of enough farming inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

She says that she chose Juhudi Kilimo because they encourage the development of farmers in the rural area. During the training, Lydia learned the importance of saving. Through this loan, she will get more poultry, which will produce more eggs for selling and thus improve her living standards. Thus her children will have a better education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Aisha is 19 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her vegetable stall, selling  tomatoes, onions and eggplants. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more tomatoes, onions and eggplants. This will help Aisha to generate greater profits and supplement basic needs at home. Aisha hopes that, in the future, she will be able to have more vegetables added. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, onions and eggplants

loans.name: Rouen

texts.en:
Rouen, 60, is married and lives with her family in a remote area of Prasat Balangk district, Kampong Thom province. She has four children, two of whom are married, while the remaining two are in school. To meet the daily needs of her family, Rouen has been farming rice for over 30 years and earns additional income from selling Khmer cakes.

Rouen is applying for a new loan which she will use to buy a set of solar home systems to install on the roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After being with Hattha Kaksekar Limited, Rouen can gain access to microfinance services and solar energy, which she uses to support household appliances such as lights, TV and radio, so everyone in her family can even work or study at night. She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a set of solar home systems to install on the roof of her house.

loans.name: Khar

texts.en:
Khar is a 51-year-old married man and a loving father of three children. He operates a small farm and grows rice in a village of Prasat Balangk, Kampong Thom province. He has been in the agricultural business for more than 10 years and also earns additional income by working as a day laborer.

Khar has applied for a loan which he will use to buy a solar home system to install on top of the roof of his house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After being with Hattha Kaksekar Limited, he can gain access to micro-finance services and solar energy, which he will use to support household appliances such as light, TV and radio, so everyone in his family can even work or study at night. He expresses his thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system to install on top of the roof of his house.

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn is woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelyn is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Angelyn requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, can goods, noodles,etc to restart her business activities.

Angelyn has been in this business for  years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Angelyn would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, can goods, noodles,etc

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is a married woman and the mother of six grown up children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a farming business for several years. She also runs a sari-sari, or retail business, selling various goods and items to people in her area.
 
Elpedia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, soap, detergents, etc. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm as well as her store. In the future, Elpedia hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Selestine

texts.en: Selestine is a 30-year-old single woman. She describes herself as polite. She operates a retail business where she sells handbags, shoes, dresses and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of handbags, shoes, dresses and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of handbags, shoes, dresses and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fruits.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don José  vive en la comunidad de  oro verde  con su esposa y sus 6 hijos   sus 3 hijos mayores ya no viven en la misma casa con el  pero si viven cercanos a la casa ya que ya han formado su familia   él se ha dedicado toda su vida a los labores del campo siembra de frijoles, maíz y maní  con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores cultivan unas tierras que tiene y sacan  buena producción la cual la venden y otra parte la dejan para consumo de la casa. Con los ingresos que ha obtenido ha comprado tres vacas  las que diario le dan 15 litros de leche  esto lo consumen en el hogar   también, hasta ahora la luz comercial no ha llegado a la comunidad  así que siguen en la oscuridad lo que  hacen es comprar candelas o usar pocos  para poder iluminarse por las noches , dice esta ansioso de poder aplicar a este crédito ya que así podrá comprar un sistema solar y instalarlo en su vivienda.
texts.en: Jose lives in the community of Oro Verde with his wife and 6 children. The three oldest children no longer live in the same house but they do live nearby and have formed their own families. For his entire life he has been doing work in the field, sowing beans, corn, and manioc. With the help of his elder children he farms some land and extracts a good harvest, part of which is sold and the other part is left for personal use. He has used the income obtained to purchase three cows that produce 15 liters of milk a day, which is also consumed at home. Currently, commercial electricity has not yet made it to the community so they continue to live in the dark and get by with candles to provide lighting at night. He says he's eager to apply for this loan so he can use it to purchase a solar system and install it in his home.

loans.use: To purchase a solar system.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is 56 years old and has five children. Aquilina is widow and has two children who are in school.

She and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Aquilina is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business, farming vegetable  Aquilina requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials.

Aquilina has been farming vegetable for  years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

With your help, Aquilinais committed to rebuild her business. In future She would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita works hard to support her family. Crestita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Crestita requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

With your help Crestita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives with her husband and 18-year-old daughter in Lorut village, in the Lori region. Susanna's husband provides a transportation service to locals, using his own car. The family is engaged in agriculture. They keep a cow, calves and chickens and cultivate potatoes and some grass. Susanna and her husband work hard to be able to earn enough income to sustain their living. 

By applying for this loan of US $2,000 Susanna asks lenders to help her to purchase 3 more calves and forage for the livestock. As this is Susanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for 3 calves and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Peace's Group

texts.en:
Peace's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Peace is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Peace has been working hard to manage her clothing shop. 

To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more shirts, trousers and skirts. This will help Peace to generate greater profits and to pay house rent. Peace hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up a library. 

Peace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, trousers and skirts

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 50-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 20 to 25. He describes himself to be respectful and understanding. He operates a retail business where he suppliers bread to customers. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with high demand and his primary customers are institutions. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bread. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. HIs previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread.

loans.name: Uong

texts.en:
Uong, together with his wife, manages their own farm, on which he grows rice for personal use and for sale. He has been cultivating rice for almost 15 years now. From this current business, he is able to earn well for the family. His income allows him to pay for daily food and other costs of commodities. He has two children who rely on his income and are attending local schools. The education of his children is his priority.

This will be his first loan which he will use to buy a solar home system to install on top of the roof of his house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After being with Hattha Kaksekar Limited, he can gain access to micro-finance services and solar energy, which he will use to support household appliances such as light, TV and radio, so everyone in his family can even work or study at night. He expresses his thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system to install on top of the roof of his house.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is married and he has 2 children. He describes himself to be hardworking. For the past 4 years, Ali has operated a retail business where he sells electronics. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. Ali describes his biggest business challenge to be theft.

Ali will use this KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will achieve his business desires. Ali will use the anticipated profits to open another shop of electronics.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Al

texts.en: Al is a single farmer who earns a living with his own farm. For four years in managing this, he earned a better income that was able to support his needs and expand the farm from his generated revenue. To buy fertilizer, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit. Al wants to ensure that his farm will produce abundantly so he manages it well. In the future, he wants to have a better living with his future family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 35 years old and married with five children, four of whom in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Emma is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Emma has requested PHP 2000 loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Emmais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, can goods, noodles, egg, etc

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 42 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Hilda has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy mulch and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is married and has a 2-year-old child. He describes himself to be determined. For the past 5 years, Fredrick has operated a retail business, selling timber and other products. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general  public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Fredrick will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of timber. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have improved his life. Fredrick will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 52 years old, is married and has 8 children. He describes himself to be self-motivated. For the past 4 years, Peter has operated a welding business where he makes metallic doors, windows and other items. His business is located in an urban area. Peter describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of materials. 

Peter will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy metal bars, metal sheets and other items. His business goal is to be getting tenders to supply items within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be the preferred supplier. This is Peter's second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully. Peter will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy metal bars, metal sheets and other items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages 4 years and 10 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. She also sells drinks to earn extra income. Her business is located in a spacious place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a clothes making firm within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a good lifestyle and have a continuous flow of income. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he makes coffins. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to open a timber yard.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 48 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Imelda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Imelda has requested PHP 3000 loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Imeldais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jecelyn

texts.en:
Jecelyn works hard to support her family. Jecelyn is  and has a candle making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Jecelyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Jecelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar lives with her husband in Spitak town. Their children are married and live separately with their families. Gohar and her husband are farmers. They run a small farm which includes a cow and three calves, as well as a plot of land where they cultivate potatoes. The land is small; therefore, the gathered potatoes are for family use only. By applying for this loan of USD 2,000, Gohar would like to purchase fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Gohar has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer living in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya with his wife and two children, both of whom are school going age. He has been doing farming for the past 13 years with his primary source of income being eggs, milk, maize and vegetables. He enjoys everything about farming since it is his main source of income. His biggest challenge is pests and diseases, and lack of capital for expanding his poultry projects.

Michael chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because he has seen his friends expand their dairy and poultry projects with the Juhudi loans and he wants to be a beneficiary of the same projects. During the training, he learnt how he can make great use of his small land by borrowing and investing in it to yield more returns. This loan will lead to an increase in egg production for selling and also for his household so that he can generate more income to improve living standards for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Meet 24-year-old young and energetic Maurine who lives in Kitale and has been farming for one year, her primary income source being a variety of crops. What has kept her going for the past one year in farming is making profits and making money that will sustain her family. Her greatest challenge is during dry seasons, where there are low returns, pests, diseases and lack of supplies during farming in some seasons.

Maurine chose Juhudi Kilimo because they understand the needs of small scale farmers, and she wants to benefit as a small scale farmer and be able to expand her farming activities. During the training, she learnt how to invest in poultry and dairy farming. She says that through this loan, she will be able to provide basic necessities and also provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun is 47 years old and grows and harvests rice to sell and for food in a region of Preah Sdach district, Prey Veng province. Farming is work that he has done since he was a young boy living with his parents. His wife helps him manage their own farm as it is the sole source of income for the family. 

This will be his first loan, which Hoeun will use it to buy a solar panel home system to install on the roof of his house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. By being with Hattha Kaksekar Limited, he can gain access to micro-finance services and solar energy, which he uses to support household appliances such as lights, TV, and radio, so everyone in his family can even work or study at night. He expresses his thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel home system to install on the roof of his house.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 42 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Melanie has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish for her dried-fish making.

Melanie has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her dried-fish making.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 46 years old and married with nine children, five of whom in school, Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Remedios is taking out a bridge loan to restart her coconut wine vending business.

She has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart  her coconut wine vending business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Remediosis committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine for her business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nieves is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nieves has been raising pigs for thirty years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is a married man from CPG, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for several years now, and it is the source of his income. Rolando is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Rolando hopes to expand his business so that it will generate more income, which is necessary for his family's needs, especially for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Lucia requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Lucia has been in this business for 20 years now. With your help Lucia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 49 years old, married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Rita has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Rita has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Rita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Norte Cojata Pampa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NORTE COJATA PAMPA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isabel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, costura de polleras, venta de verduras, venta de carne, tejido de chompas, venta de pan.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isabel es integrante, ella indica que es hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio que sus amigas tenían, de las cuales aprendió el oficio y al aprender el mismo invierte un pequeño capital en él.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Norte Cojata Pampa Communal Bank will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors of which Isabel is the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including weaving blankets, sewing "polleras" (traditional skirts), selling meat, weaving sweaters, and selling bread.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Isabel.  She said she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, having joined on the invitation of a counselor for the institution who visited her in her home.  Currently she has a business selling vegetables.  Her friends were in the business and she learned the trade from them and invested some capital in it.

Isabel will use her loan to increase her capital and buy vegetables from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto to sell in her sales stall.  This job allows her to generate income to help her family, because she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Ken Lliemark

texts.en: Ken Lliemark is a  dedicated son who wants to become successful in the future. She studied BS Criminology in a university. Hos mother  works as a government employee as a teacher. He has two siblings depending his parents . He need financial assistance to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester. With his GDMPC education loan, he will be able to lessen his mother's financial problems and hopefully in the future,he would find a better job and able to help his family and his community as well.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Ma. Lolita

texts.en:
Ma. Lolita works hard to support her family. Ma. Lolita is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Ma. Lolita requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ma. Lolita has been in this business for  years now. With your help Ma. Lolita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Ma. Lolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.  Gemma is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 75 años de edad, se casó hace 26 años,  luego de vivir acompañado con su actual esposa por más de 10 años, es padre de 7 hijos todos ya mayores de edad y que viven con sus propias familias por separado.
En su casa de habitación vive su esposa y un hijo quien es enfermo y al cual tienen que estar cuidando con su esposa todos los días, padece de una enfermedad desde pequeño.
José no estudio, pues sus padres lo crecieron trabajando en la agricultura y la ganadería en pequeño.
José trabaja la agricultura desde los 10 años de edad, cuando su padre le enseño los trabajos en los cultivos de maíz y frijoles, así como el mezcal, además en su familia tenían vacas criollas las cuales tenía que cuidar desde la mañana para luego irse a los cultivos.
Actualmente se dedica a los cultivos de maíz y frijoles, lo hace él solo y tiene que pagar mozos para salir en los tiempos indicados. Su esposa tiene que cuidar a su hijo enfermito.
Solicita un crédito en credicampo, para comprar una vaca valorada en $700.00, el resto lo necesita para arreglar los potreros.
José sueña con seguir trabajando para darle a su esposa y a su hijo una buena calidad de vida, también quiere ir poco a poco comprando ganado de repasto para ir saliendo adelante poco a poco.
texts.en:
José is 75 years old. He got married 26 years ago and he has been living with his present wife for more than 10 years. He is the father of 7 children, all of whom are adults and live separately with their own families. In his house he lives with his wife and her son who has been sick since he was small and has to be cared for every day by his wife. 

José never studied as his parents raised him working as a farmer and raising livestock. José has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old. His father taught him to grow beans and corn and also mescal. Besides this his family raised native cows which they had to tend before going off to work in the fields. Today he grows corn and beans by himself. He has to pay day labor at certain times of the season as his wife has to tend to the sick son. 

José is requesting a loan from Credicampo to buy a cow worth $700. The rest he will use to fix his fields. José dreams of continuing to work to provide his wife and her son a good quality of living. He also wants to buy more cattle little by little to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fix his fields.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 64 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar ella se dedica a la confección de uniformes desde hace más de 4 años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea invertir en su negocio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de materiales para la confección de uniformes como: hilo, tela, botones y zippers ya que desea ampliar su negocio con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 64 years old and lives in her own house with her family.  She has worked making clothes for more than 4 years.  In this way, she makes a living and supports her family.  She wants to invest in her business and so is asking for this loan through FUSAI.

She will buy materials for clothesmaking such as thread, fabric, buttons, and zippers.  She wants to expand her business so she can improve her income and improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy thread, fabric, buttons, and zippers for clothes-making.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 43 years old and married with five children, four of whom in school, Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nora is taking out a bridge loan to restart her food vending business.

She has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart  her food vending business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Norais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is 30 years old, married with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Bebelyn has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Bebelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Bebelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Bebelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Cecilia tienen 60 años y en su juventud solo curso cuarto grado ya sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarle en sus estudios. Ella es casada y madre de dos hijos siendo el mayor y su esposo quienes se involucren más en las diferentes actividades de campo que llevan un poco más de trabajo como la limpieza y la menor la cual estudia en la secundaria en su tercer año de ciclo común básico. Ella es agricultora quien se dedica desde hace unos años a la siembra y cultivo de hortalizas (zanahoria) ya que en la zona donde ella habita el clima, la tierra y la mayoría de personas se dedican a dicha actividad siendo factor problema los diferentes insumos que son utilizados para dar el cuidado y asistencia necesario y no la competencia. Su experiencia es de más de 30 años aprendiendo de sus padres por vocación y descendencia dicho rubro al igual que los trabajos de alfarería como otro medio de ingreso para su familia y hogar. Su área de cultivo está ubicado en la misma propiedad donde está construida su casa de habitación permitiendo esto dar una asistencia mayormente personalizada pero su mercado meta está a una distancia de 20 kilómetros y para llegar a dicho mercado viaja en auto bus de ruta de la comunidad.
Su meta es seguir mejorando su calidad de vida, aumentar más el área de tierra para poder cultivar más zanahoria y poder también sembrar otra clase de hortaliza. Para con su hija apoyarla para que termine sus estudios y pueda graduarse a nivel secundario para posterior mente apoyarla en una carrera universitaria. Por lo que hoy doña Cecilia solicita apoyo para la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayuden al cuidado y protección de sus cultivos esperando ser apoyada con su petición por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA.
texts.en: Cecilia is 60 years old and was only able to finish up to the fourth grade when she was a child since her low-income parents weren't able to provide for her schooling. She's married and is a mother of two children, the eldest of whom works alongside her husband on a variety of farming tasks that are somewhat more labor-intensive, such as weeding. The younger of her two children is in the third year of general education at high school. She's a farmer who has been sowing and harvesting vegetables (carrots) for several years and in her area due to the climate and the soil the majority of people work in this activity. The problem isn't competition, it's the various supplies used for necessary care and maintenance. She has over 30 years of experience and learned this job by choice and by ancestry, as well as pottery to provice another source of income for her family and household. The area she farms is on the same property her house was built on, which allows her to tend to it more dilligently, however her target market is 20 kilometers away and she travels by public bus to get there. Her goal is to continue improving her quality of life, increase the amount of land being farmed to be able to harvest more carrots and also sow another type of vegetable. She also plans to help her daughter complete her studies and graduate from high school and subsequently work on a university degree. That's why Cecilia is requesting help to purchase agricultural supplies for the care and protection of her crops and hopes to receive help from KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to help and maintain her carrot crops.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay, 19 years old, lives with her parents and four siblings. His parents earns from their work as electrician and his mother as a food handler . He is a student at the university taking up Computer Programming. He had a part time job as a sound system operator in their village and often requested in many different activities.

He is requesting a loan to pay the school tuition and graduation fees. His goal is to continue working and encourage his siblings to continue studying so that they both prepare for their better future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition and graduation fees

loans.name: Kimberly Jayne

texts.en:
Kimberly Jayne is a hardworking 17 year old lady. She was  studying in a university taking up BS Hotrl and Restaurant Management. 

Kimberly Jayne had five siblings and she  is someone who is very dedicated to her studies and love of family. Her father worked as a painter in order to earn a living.
She is requesting this loan to pay the school tuition fees  for the second semester. Her goal is to fine better career and   become professionals and could earn better income for their own.In the future, she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition for the second semester

loans.name: Phath's Group

texts.en: Phath is 47 years old and is a married mother of nine children, three of whom are in school. To address their struggles to cover the daily cost of living, Phath does rice cropping as the main source of her income and works for others for a fee. She has operated in this business for ages. Now her living condition is improving, due to her past loans which she has fully repaid. This is Phath's second micro loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay a farmland leasing fee. Phath hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for farmland leasing fee.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is 51 years old and has five children, one of whom in school.

She and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Reynalda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business, raising pigs Reynalda requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Reynalda has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

With your help, Reynaldais committed to rebuild her business. In future She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 44 years old and married with five children who are in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rowena is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Rowena has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Rowenais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Flor es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. ella tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Flor is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has been selling fruits and vegetables, such as strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, and other types of produce for several years. Through her business, she has gained a great deal of experience in making sales so that she can improve her earnings.

The place where she sells is very strategic for this type of business since it is always busy and filled with people. Flor has many customers who prefer to do business with her because her products are fresh, priced well, and are of quality. She also provides excellent service. Flor is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and has the drive to forge ahead. She is always looking for ways to become successful.

Demand has increased within the past few weeks, so she wants to take advantage of this time by making a new investment. However, she does not have sufficient capital to accomplish this. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. Flor has good payment references. She is grateful for the support and is confident that she can repay this debt. At the same time, she will be able to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es: Ruth tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella posee una tienda en su hogar de residencia en la cual comercializa variedad de productos de tienda como: sal, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, pan dulce, detergente, etc. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta Ruth por lo que desea invertir en la compra de variedad de productos de tienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor inventario para la tienda como: pan dulce, arroz, azúcar, sal, frijoles, detergente, etc. Espera poder contar con este apoyo ya que no puede hacerlo por su cuenta.
texts.en: Ruth is 29 years old and she lives in her own house along with her family group. She has a store in her home where she sells a variety of retail products such as salt, sugar, beans, candies, sweet bread, detergents, etc. This business is the principal source of income for Ruth, and so she wants to invest in the purchase of a variety of retail products. She is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of greater inventory for the store by buying such items as sweet bread, rice, sugar, salt, beans, detergent, etc. She hopes to be able to have this support, since she cannot do it on her own.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread, rice, sugar, salt, beans, detergent, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Aventura Group

texts.es: Dirigido por la señora Mayling con 27 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos en las edades de 10 y 6 años, se dedica a la elaboración de calzado de niños, adultos con material sintético, oficio heredados de los padres quienes han trabajado en este sector, desea adquirir este préstamo para comprar materiales como cuero sintético, pega, suelas, hebillas, entre otros. El grupo además integrado por la señora Patricia de 23 años la cual comercializa cosméticos AVON  y socia Yaneris de 25 años  vende bisuterías.
texts.en: Señora Mayling manages the communal bank.  She is 27-years old, married and the mother of two children, who are 10- and 6-years old respectively.  She earns her living making children's and adult shoes using synthetic materials.  Señora Mayling learned the trade from her parents, who also worked in that sector.  She wants this loan to purchase materials like synthetic leather, glue, soles, buckles and other items.  The other members of the communal bank are señora Patricia, who is 23-years old and sells Avon cosmetics, and Yaneris, who is 25-years old and sells costume jewelry.

loans.use: to invest in materials like synthetic leather, glue, soles, buckles, shoe adornments etc.

loans.name: Sal Lyn

texts.en:
Sal Lyn, 20 years old, lives with his parents and three siblings. His parents earns from employment as Philippine National Police (PNP. His mother is the one taking care of their family.He is a student at the university taking up Bachelor of Science in Criminology.  He had no part time job and all this time he is depending his parents.

Thanks God of knowing GDMPC and he is requesting a loan to pay the school tuition fee for the second semester this school year. If he graduates from the university successfully, it will be great help for the family. His parents were a hardworking individual who wants better future for their children.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the second semester this school year

loans.name: Glaisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Glaisa works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Glaisa is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell to customers.

Glaisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 58 years old, married and has nine children.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Thelma is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business, pig fattening Thelma requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Thelma has been pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
