With your help, Thelmais committed to rebuild her business. In future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Savuth's Group

texts.en:
Savuth is a 29 year-old resident of Battambang province. She is also a mother of three dependent kids, two schoolchildren and one child too young for school. She strives for a living by rice farming on five hectares of farmland and works for others for a fee to supplement her income.

This is not the first loan cycle for Savuth with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now applying for a new loan and she leads the group of three. She and one of her co-borrowers are requesting loan of 1,400,000 KHR each while a remaining co-borrower is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy a decent mini-tractor to support her farmland. She believes that she can gain a better yield than previously.

loans.use: To buy a decent mini-tractor to support her farmland

loans.name: Ichelegbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ICHELEGBE est composé de vingt six personnes qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, nommée Dénise Monrènikè (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 46 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Dénise Monrènikè est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Eloi. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Dénise Monrènikè vit avec son mari et ses enfants.  Les diverses charges de la famille sont assumées par Dénise Monrènikè et son mari. Pour ce faire, Dénise Monrènikè vend des pommades et du vin de palme de façon ambulante depuis trente ans. Dénise Monrènikè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de diversifier son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Dénise Monrènikè ensemble avec les membres du groupement ICHELEGBE sollicitent pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Ichelegbe group is composed of 26 people who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, by the name of Dénise Monrènikè (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 46 years old. She did not attend school. She is married to Eloi, a tailor. They have four children, some of whom are in school. Dénise Monrènikè lives with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various family needs. In order to do so, Dénise Monrènikè has been selling ointments and palm vine as a street vendor for over 30 years. She stocks up at a market  in Benin. With the goal of diversifying her business and better meeting customer demand, Dénise Monrènikè, together with the other members of her group, is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy ointments and palm vine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Tierra Mía Group

texts.es: Señora Victoria coordinadora del grupo, soltera  55 años de edad vende derivados del maíz como pinol, pinolillo, cereal, pozol, etc.   Posee siete hijos y a cargo solo uno menor de 16 años todos ayudándole a procesar y venderlo en sus trabajos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maíz por quintal, cacao, canela, rodamina, bolsas plásticas, clavo de olor, etc. También el grupo lo conforman  el socio Gustavo con 57 años quien vende frutas  de temporada como   níspero, mandarinas, jocotes, mangos etc.  la  socia Yajaira con 40 años de edad quien  vende frutas de temporadas mangos, jocotes, mandarinas  y ropa usada.
texts.en: Victoria is the coordinator of the group. She is single and 55 years old. She sells corn-derived products such as pinol/pinolillo [a drink made from toasted cornmeal and cacao], cereal, pozol [a drink made from corn boiled with cinnamon and mixed with water or milk], etc. She has seven children, only one of which is still a minor, 16 years old. They all help her to process and sell her products at their places of work. She will use the loan to buy ingredients such as corn by the 100-pound sack, cacao, cinnamon, plastic bags, cloves, etc. The other members of the group are Gustavo, 57 years old, who sells seasonal fruits such as loquats, tangerines, jocotes, mangos, etc., and Yajaira, 40 years old, who sells seasonal fruits such as mangos, jocotes, and tangerines, and used clothing.

loans.use: to buy a 100-pound sack of corn, cacao, cinnamon, plastic bags, cloves, etc

loans.name: Dayriel

texts.en: Dayriel is studying information technology in a university in Misamis Occidental. He has been earning from  a part time job in one of the photo studios in town which help him in his studies. He has eight siblings and his parents who earn their wages from laboring which is not easy to handle. He often share his income to his siblings for their needs too. His previous loan was used for the tuition fees for the first semester. and currently, he took a new loan for the second semester tuition fees. He wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: for the second semester tuition fees

loans.name: Los Madrugadores Group

texts.es: Coordinado por la señora María casada y de 34 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de las edades de 20 y 14 años,  se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de tortilla en su domicilio y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor para la elaboración de dicho producto, el crédito lo piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima como es el maíz, cal, leñas  para aumentar las ventas y consigo obtener más beneficios tanto en el negocio como en lo personal. También lo conforman el grupo  el señor Edmundo de 54 años de edad dedicado a la venta de comida con especialidad en sopas y la señora Silvia de 41 años dedicada a la venta de productos  de cosméticos de la AVON.
texts.en:
The coordinator of this communal bank is Señora Maria. She is married and is 34 years old. She is the mother of two children, ages 20 and 14. She makes and sells tortillas in her home and has the help of her older daughter to make this product. She is thinking of investing the loan in the purchase of basic materials such as corn, lime, and firewood to increase her sales and with that to obtain more benefits in her business as well as in her personal life. 

The group is also formed by Señor Edmundo, who is 54 years old and sells food, specializing in soup, and Señora Silvia, who is 41 years old and sells Avon cosmetic products.

loans.use: to invest in 100-lb sacks of corn, lime, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell and to buy a bed for her children.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Annalyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Annalyn has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 24 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. Joshua practices poultry farming, whereby he sells chicken. He does business from home. Joshua started the business because he never wanted a white-collar job. Joshua has a great dream to have a bigger poultry business serving the people in and outside his town so as to make more profits however, he is challenged by weather changes and inadequate capital to expand and maintain his business. Joshua will use the loan to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Corazón De María  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Corazón de María está formado por 7 mujeres que son vecinas y amigas, todas son mujeres trabajadoras y muy luchadoras que día a día buscan la manera de mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. Vive por el sector de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen vivas las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Luz, tiene 30 años de edad, está separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 13, 11, 9, 8 y 3 años, su primera hija está estudiando en el colegio y tres hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la comunidad, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
Doña Luz pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, sus ingresos económicos los obtiene de la crianza de pollos que vende pelados o en pie, también trabaja en una escuelita como conserje. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y  alimento para los mismos. Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Corazón de María” (Heart of Mary) consists of seven women who are neighbors and friends. All of them are hardworking and determined women who look for ways to improve the financial stability of their households every day. They live in the sector of Yanaturo in the city of Cuenca, which has the third largest economy in Ecuador. In December 1999, Cuenca was named a World Heritage Site. The people are friendly, kind, and have warm hearts. They have kept their culture and traditions alive.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Luz. She is 30 years old and separated from her husband. Their relationship resulted in the five children (ages 13, 11, 9, 8, and 3). Her oldest daughter is in high school and the next three children attend an elementary school in the community. She owns the house in which she and her family live.

Doña Luz spends her time at home by looking after her children. Her income is derived from raising chickens and selling them butchered or alive. She also works at an elementary school as a janitor. The money from this loan will be used to buy more chickens and feed for the birds. Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is a driver who operates a service based business that provides transportation in their village to make a living. He earns well from this to provide the needs of his five children. He is 47 and have four children. He had to work hard aside from farming in order to provide his children a better education. His wife works as Overseas Filipino Worker and she earns well from this. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC  micro credit to cover the cost for motor maintenance. In the near future, he had plan to build a store for his wife. He wants to improve the general living of his family.

loans.use: to cover the cost for motor maintenance

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is married with three children who range in age from 8 to 13 years old. Joel drives his motorcycle, known as a habal-habal, to offer transportation services in his neighborhood. Joel is also engaged in a rice farming business. These are the sources of his income.

Joel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. Through this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm thus augmenting his harvest and yield. With this additional productivity, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Don Rigoberto es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de Ferretería y pulpería. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado implementar un nuevo negocio y así poder salir adelante. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Galletas, Jugos, Bebidas gaseosas, Cintas métricas, entre otros artículos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar su inventario y así lograra abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Don Rigoberto is originally from the city of Bosco. He is a businessman who has a hardware store and a grocery store. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito, since he has succeeded in setting up a new business and thus has been able to get ahead. He is applying for a new loan to buy crackers, juices, soft drinks, and tape measures, among other items. He feels that the loan will be a great help to him, since he will be able to increase his inventory and thus meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy crackers, juices, soft drinks, and tape measures, among other items.

loans.name: Fredesmida

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Fredesmida works hard to support her family.

She has a raising livestock business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Fredesmida is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock for her raising livestock business.

Fredesmida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a farmer in the remote village of Nyarubungo Masha in Isingiro district. He is married with 5 children, all in school. He started cattle keeping at an early age, as it was the main economic activity in his village. After the death of his father, he struggled to help his family survive by cattle farming where he sold milk, bulls and cows that he bought and then sold at a profit. 

When he started his own family, he started his own farm. Now he is requesting a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to buy more cattle for fattening. He thanks Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for partnering with him.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Santos Rosibel

texts.es:
Santos de 28  años de edad, se acompañó a los 26 años de edad, con su esposo tiene una niña de 3 años, estudio séptimo grado en el centro escolar del municipio donde vie, luego murió su madre y ya no pudo seguir estudiando, se fue a vivir donde su abuela, por lo cual dejo de estudiar.
Su esposo trabaja de ayudante de albañil en la comunidad.
Ella por su parte se dedica a la venta de ropa en la comunidad y en los alrededores desde hace cuatro años, cuando decidió incursionar en el negocio de la ropa para todas las edades, le enseño su prima y desde entonces ella está luchando cada día para ayudar a su esposo en el crecimiento de su hija y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Vende tres días a la semana dependiendo de la demanda de los clientes, antes se dedicaba al cuido del hogar.
Solicita un crédito en credicampo, para invertir $300 en la compra de mercadería  (ropa) para comercializarla en la comunidad y lugares aledaños, el resto lo necesita para gastos en el hogar.
Así Santos tendrá más inventario y podrá contar con más variedades de ropa para sus clientes y así poder obtener mayores ingresos.
Ella sueña con ir creciendo poco a poco en su negocio de venta de ropa, además planea hacer su propia casa donde vivir con su hija y su esposo.
Planea trabajar muy duro para apoyar a su hija en la escuela y que logre culminar una carrera profesional en el futuro. Las ganancias producto de las ventas las va ahorrando para hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Santos is 28-years old.  She got married when she was 26, and she and her husband have a 3-year old daughter.  Santos went to a local city school through 7th grade.  Then her mother died and she couldn't keep going to school.  She went to live with her grandmother, which is why she stopped going to school. 
Santos's husband works as a bricklayer's assistant in their community. 
For her part, Santos has made her living for the past four years selling clothing in her community and in the surrounding areas.  When she decided to get into selling clothing for all ages, a cousin taught her how.  Since then, Santos has been working hard each day to help her husband raise their daughter and to have a better quality of life. 
Santos sells her merchandise three days a week, depending on her customers' demand.  Previously, she was a homemaker. 
Santos is requesting a loan from Credicampo to invest $300 in purchasing merchandise (clothing) to sell in her community and surrounding areas.  The rest she needs for household expenses. 
With the loan, Santos will have more inventory and a greater variety of clothing to sell to her customers.  This will enable her to earn a better income. 
Santos hopes to keep growing her clothing sales business little by little.  In addition, she plans to build her own house where she can live with her daughter and her husband. 
Santos plans to work very hard to support her daughter in her education so that in the future, she can have a career.  She is saving what she earns from her clothing sales for building her house.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing) to sell in her community and surrounding areas.  The rest of the loan she needs for household expenses.

loans.name: Alba Angelica

texts.es: Alba tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 16 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Alba se gana la vida mediante la venta de deliciosas tostadas de plátano y yuca las cuales comercializa en la escuela de su localidad. Tiene tres años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y muchos clientes que cada día prefieren más sus productos. Alba desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de  yuca, plátanos, chile, bolsas, limón, etc. Confía que de esta forma logrará mejorar sus ingresos los cuales le permitirán dar mejores condiciones de vida a su hija.
texts.en: Alba is 32 years old and lives in her own house along with her daughter, who is 16 years old and is in school. Alba earns a living by selling delicious plantain and yucca tostadas, which she sells at her neighborhood school. She has had this business for three years, and so she has a lot of experience and many customers who prefer her products more every day. Alba wants to invest in her business by buying the necessary supplies, for which she is applying to FUSAI for this loan, to invest in the purchase of yucca, plantains, peppers, bags, lemons, etc. She is confident that in this way she will succeed in improving her income, which will allow her to give her daughter better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy yucca, plantains, peppers, bags, lemons, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Gina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to resell.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is a fisherman from CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and the father of an eleven-year-old child. Wilfredo is requesting  a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat. He is optimistic that this loan could help him improve his business, thus making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na, 44, is a local villager in Moung Russey district in Battambang province. She is blessed with four kids, two of whom are in school. To secure decent food for her kids, she grows rice and sesame as the main source of income. She has been occupied with this work for more than 10 years now.

This is the fifth loan for Na with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely. Her previous loans enabled her to improve her lifestyle as compared to beforehand. Now, she is teaming up as part of a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can gain a better income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, vita, pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Chhim's Group

texts.en: Chhim is 60 years old and a local villager from Battambang province. She is a mother of four children. Currently only one child is staying with her as this child is helping with the family’s business. To support the family, she farms rice on one hectare of farmland and works as a paid worker for income. She has been with this business for 15 years, and she can earn up to 25,800 KHR per day. Now, she is a leader of a two borrower lending group to obtain a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is the first microloan for Chhim, who requested 500,000 KHR, and her joint borrower who applied for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that her rice will produce a good crop yield for her to support the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Lun's Group

texts.en: A citizen from Battambang province, Lun is 58 years old and the mother of five children. To earn income to support the family, she grows rice and cassava as the main source of income with which she has been occupied for ages. Nowadays, her family's living conditions are better. It is the positive impact resulting from her past loans which she has fully repaid. Now, she has formed a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for replanting her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for replanting her crop.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 51 years old and widowed with 4four three of whom are in school. Angeles works very hard to provide for them.

Angeles runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Angeles has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Angeles would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Edmundo

texts.es:
El señor Nelson Edmundo es un joven que vive en la ciudad de Ocotal en el departamento de nueva Segovia en el  norte del país, él está feliz mente casada y con dos hijos, cabe mencionar que él es el sostén de la familia.
Este joven tiene aproximadamente unos seis años de laborar en la empresa de acueductos donde él es el responsable de cobranza de la filial donde trabaja, el labora de lunes a viernes de 7 am a 5 pm.
Él se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar formalmente un préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de su universidad ya que él está sacando  una carrera y mejorar su nivel académico y así poder desempeñarse mejor y a un buen nivel en su campo laboral. 
Él se muestra optimista que dicho financiamiento será aprobado para poder superarse y por ende mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Nelson Edmundo is a young man who lives in the city of Ocotal, Nueva Segovia Department in the north of the country.  He is happily married with two children.  It is worth mentioning that he supports the family. 
This young man has been working for about six years for an aqueduct company, where he is responsible for the collecting the water bill payments in an assigned area.  He works from Monday to Friday, 7:00am to 5:00pm.
Señor Nelson Edmundo came to the Ceprodel offices to formally request a loan to help pay for his university expenses.  He is getting a degree to further his education and thereby have more to offer at a higher level in his field of work. 
He is optimistic that his loan will approved and that he will be able to better himself professionally and consequently improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to make his monthly tuition payment to the university.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 60 years old and married with nine children. With three children in school, Josefa works very hard to provide for them.

Josefa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josefa has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Josefa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a house rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood, etc. for the maintenance of the house for her house rental business.

Milagros has been in this business for 10 years. Milagros earns more income from general store.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, etc. for the maintenance of the house

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia tiene 58 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad, que con mucho sacrificio y con la ayuda de su marido han podido crear.
La señora Nimia es profesora jubilada, una vez que dejó de enseñar, viajó al extranjero, allí trabajó por 2 años, en ese tiempo le enviaba dinero a su esposo y con ese dinero pudieron abrir una despensa. Hace aproximadamente 2 años que volvió al país, hoy en día y gracias a la buena administración y al trabajo en conjunto han podido mejorar bastante. Esta es una pareja luchadora que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante.
Nimia pide este préstamo para darles mayor calidad y conservación a sus productos a sus clientes, ya que quiere comprar un congelador para su despensa. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de mejorar.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia is 58 years old, married, and has two grown children. She was able to raise them with great sacrifice and the help of her husband.

Sra. Nimia is a retired schoolteacher. After she quit teaching, she traveled abroad and worked another two years. During this time, she sent money to her husband and he used it to open a food pantry. She returned to Paraguay approximately two years ago. Thanks to their work and the good management of this business, she and her husband have made significant improvements together. This couple has been able to forge ahead by making sacrifices.

Nimia is requesting a loan so that she can provide and preserve better quality products for her customers. She wants to buy a freezer for her food pantry. Nimia is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can improve.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and married with four children, who are all in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sardines, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en: Dave is a 25 year-old married man and a father of an only child. He is trying hard to provide their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. He is in the agriculture business of growing and selling rice with the support of his wife who manages the household chores and some farm works. Through this, he earns a good amount of income to support household expenditures. In order to grow more produce in the near future, he has requested a loan to buy  fertilizer.  He expects this to boost his earnings and profits. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia works hard to support her family. Anastacia is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Anastacia requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gears and other materials for her business.

Anastacia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Anastacia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gears and other materials for her business

loans.name: Emilce Del Socorro

texts.es: Emilce es separada y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, es trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene una experiencia de 7 años trabajando como vendedora en diferentes restaurantes del municipio. Actualmente adquirió un negocio donde también vende comidas en general, su sueño es ampliar el restaurante y adecuarlo para mejorar la imagen y lograr que sea un lugar agradable para quienes lo visitan a degustar sus deliciosos platos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  cafetera, calentador, vitrinas y otros artículos importantes para el buen funcionamiento de su restaurante.  De esta manera sus ingresos se reflejarán en mayores ingresos y mejorando mucho más su calidad de vida y el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emilce is separated and has two grown children. She is hardworking and enterprising.

Emilce has seven years of experience working as a seller at different restaurants within the city. At the moment, she has a business that she acquired where she sells food in general. Her dream is to expand and remodel the restaurant in order to improve the appearance and make it an enjoyable place where people can visit and enjoy delicious dishes.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of a coffee maker, a food warmer, display cases, and other important items to make her restaurant functional. Her income will be reflected in the higher revenue she can generate, which will help to greatly improve her quality of life and the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy a coffee maker, a food warmer, display cases, and other items.

loans.name: Luis Rogelio

texts.es: Luis tiene 61 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos. Luis es un hombre trabajador quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tostadas de plátano y yuca desde hace más de tres año. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad y gracias a su carisma ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día lo prefieren más. Luis desea invertir en su negocio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos como: yuca, plátanos, limones, chile, bolsas de plástico, etc. De esta forma espera mejorar sus ventas así como sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida como las de su familia.
texts.en: Luis is 61 years old and he lives in his own house along with his children. Luis is a hardworking person who has been making and selling fried plantain and cassava chips for more than three years. He makes his sales as a street vendor in the high-traffic areas of his town, and thanks to his charisma, he has been able to earn the trust of many clients who prefer him more each day. Luis would like to invest in his business, so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as: cassava, plantains, limes, chili powder, plastic bags, etc. In his way he hopes to improve his sales and thereby his income, which will allow him to improve his and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cassava, plantains, limes, chili powder, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro de 48 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros dedes hace varios años,  cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo, Milagro solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior por mayor ya que posee gran demanda por parte de muchas personas, con lo que podrá adquirir en diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milagro is 48 years old and has been selling women’s and men’s undergarments for several years. She has many established customers, so she is able to keep her business afloat. With the revenue she generates from her sales, she is able to pay for some of her household expenses. Milagro lives with her life companion and her son.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of undergarments in bulk since there is great demand among many people. Milagro will be able to acquire products of different prices, styles, and colors so that she can attract more customers and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy undergarments in bulk.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 61 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cornelia has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Cornelia requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Cornelia has been in this business for 10 years. Cornelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Ana works very hard to provide for them.

Ana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, candies, noodles, etc. to sell.

Ana has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, candies, noodles, etc. 

Ana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, candies, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family. Elsie is married and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Elsie requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional packs of frozen foods to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Clara Telma

texts.es:
Doña Clara tiene un grado de educación de primaria incompleta el cual pudo cursar hasta el cuarto año, acompañada y madre de 3 hijos el mayor quien está terminando la secundaria y los dos menores en la primaria en la escuela y colegio de la comunidad. Su compañero de hogar y ella son quienes más se involucre en las diferentes actividades de campo y su hijo mayor al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles. El cultivo de zanahoria es la actividad financiera de su familia en la cual trabajan desde hace más de 5 años dedicándose al igual que la mayoría de los habitantes también a la alfarería siendo sus clientes los diferentes habitantes de la zona y el mercado el cual está ubicado a 20 kilómetros desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en auto bus. 
Sus metas, planes y sueños, poder seguir ampliando sus parcelas de tierra para poder seguir cultivando zanahoria  al igual que poder diversificar sus cultivos sembrando otra clase de hortalizas. Para con sus hijos poder apoyarlos en sus estudios de manera que ellos puedan culminarlos y preparase académicamente para que no pasen por la misma situación que ella y su padre en su juventud. Doña Clara solicita apoyo para la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayuden al crecimiento, protección, entre otros de animales, plagas y factor clima para obtener un excelente ingreso al final de la temporada.
texts.en:
Clara didn't finish elementary school; she was only able to complete up to fourth grade.  She's married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest is finishing secondary school and the two youngest attend school in the community.

She and her companion are the ones who are most involved in the various farming activities, along with her oldest son, when he's done with his school activities.  Growing carrots is her family's financial activity.  They've been doing it for more than five years.  They also work in pottery like the majority of the residents.  Her customers are the various residents of the area and the market that's located 20 kilometers from her home.  They get there on the bus.

Clara's goals, plans, and dreams are to be able to keep on expanding her property so she can grow carrots, and to diversify her crops and grow other vegetables.  She wants to be able to support her children in their studies so they can finish school and be academically prepared and not go through the same thing she and their father did in their youth.

Clara's requesting support to buy agricultural inputs to help grow her crops and protect them from animals, pests, and the climate.  That way she'll earn an excellent income at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her carrot crop

loans.name: Rafaelito

texts.en: Rafaelito works in his parlor aside form selling appliances for more than six years. Her earns well that he had successfully repay his previous loan used for buying new items for sale. He also has had a beauty parlor where he had earn for fifteen years. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional spa and beauty products on order to improve services that he had started. In the future, he wants to improve the business to endure better source of income for his better living.

loans.use: to purchase additional spa and beauty products

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Vanessa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Vanessa is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Vanessa has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 57 years old and has five children. Evangeline is married and has one child who is still in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evangeline has been farming rice for 7 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas is a farmer living with his family. He has been growing and selling his farm produce for many years. With his income, he was able to provide his family and had successfully repay his previous loan used for his farm. To improve and develop a greener farm, he took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer. He wants to sustain the farm and ensure better source of income for a better living of his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.en:
Fabiola is 57 years old and married with five children. Fabiola works very hard to provide for them.

Fabiola runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Fabiola has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, sugar, soft-drinks, shampoo and other groceries. 

Fabiola would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 35-year-old married man. He has two children, aged 2 and 4 years. He describes himself as faithful and hopeful. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his customers are both male and female. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of finances. 

Amos will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he can educate his children and expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Evalita

texts.en:
Evalita is a married woman from CPG, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in retail sales. She runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods to the people in her area.

Evalita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, soap, toiletries, coffee, sugar, and cooking ingredients. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Evalita hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has four children ranging in age from 3 to 12 years. She describes herself as passionate. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a ready market. She describes her biggest business challenge as rainy weather, which affects business. 

Joyce will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal and to buy materials to put up a business stall. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and materials to put up a business stall

loans.name: Priska

texts.en:
Priska is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children, aged 5 and 8 years. She describes herself as hopeful. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a populated area. 

Priska will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more sewing machines. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good lifestyle. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Kara Christine

texts.en:
Kara Christine is single and has a direct selling avon products business in the Philippines.

Kara Christine requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products of avon to sell to her customers.

Kara Christine has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Kara Christine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products of avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Michelle is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Michelle has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hamaspyur

texts.en:
Hamaspyur lives in Por village with her husband. She is an accountant working at the local village art school. In addition, Hamaspyur, together with her husband, is involved in beekeeping. She currently keeps 25 colonies of bees and gets high-quality honey. Her husband sells the honey locally and gathers income for living. 

Hamaspyur has now applied for this loan of 900 USD to be able to purchase six colonies of bees and enlarge the production of honey. She has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, after ensuring that the production of honey is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Hamaspyur has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for six colonies of bees

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Meet Richard, a farmer who hails from the Kitale area of South Rift, Kenya. He lives with his wife and six children. He has been farming for the past 17 years; his primary sources of income are milk, eggs, maize, and beans, and he has a retail business. In farming, he enjoys feeding chicken and collecting eggs both for family consumption and for selling. His biggest challenges are pests and diseases, drought, and lack of capital.

Richard chose Juhudi Kilimo because it offers financial support to small-scale farmers. During the training, he learned that microfinance institutions lend money to small-scale farmers at low interest rates. This loan will lead to more income because of an increase in egg production and will enable him to pay his children's school fees and improve living standards for the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 34 years old, from Nyandarua South, and is married with two children, 18 years and seven years old.

She has been farming for many years and has applied for her sixth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy seedlings and fertilizer. Lucy is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan and hopes to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and pay for school fees.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Pasac (8) Group

texts.es:
Manuel es un Hombre casado de 52 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos, el primero de 13 años quien está en sexto primaria y el segundo de 10 años quien está en  quinto primaria. Actualmente viven en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. El se encuentra con una playera blanca en la parte izquierda.
Manuel comenta que la actividad que realiza es la siembra de maxan ya que es un producto rentable. Eligió esta labor porque le gusta y además de ello obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a colaborar con la economía de su familia.
Manuel ha venido realizando esta actividad desde hace varios años, por lo que ahora ha adquirido más conocimiento en esta área, así que un día tomo la decisión de formar un grupo con el objetivo de diversificar sus productos en el mercado y de esta manera obtener un ingreso para mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes del grupo. El préstamo lo utilizaran para el mantenimiento de maxan.
Su sueño comprar un terreno para poder incrementar su negocio y así ofrecerles un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 52-year-old married man. He lives with his two children. The first is thirteen and is in the sixth grade of primary school while the second is ten and is in the fifth grade of primary school. Currently, they live in the Suchitepequez department. He is in a whit t-shirt on the left [of the photo].

Manuel mentions that the business he carries out is the planting of maxan [Calathea lutea] as it is a profitable product. He chose this work because he likes it and because he makes a good income and profit that help him contribute to his family's finances.

Manuel has made his living doing this for several years, so that now he has acquired more knowledge in this area. As such, one day he decided to form a group with the goal of diversifying their products in the market. This way they will make an income to improve the family finances of the members of the group. They will use the loan for the maintenance of maxan.

His dream is to buy a plot of land to be able to increase his and business and in that way offer good service to his customers.

loans.use: to maintain his maxan [Calathea lutea] crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en:
Savorn is a farmer from the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 63 years old and a widowed mother of five children. To cover the daily cost of living for her entire household, she raises pigs as the main source of income and works as a paid worker for another fee. She has been involved with this business for 40 years and it earns her about 35,700 KHR per day.

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two loans which she has repaid. This loan has enabled her to improve her living conditions. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total amount of her entire group loan is 2,600,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy pig’s feed and more pigs to raise. She believes that her business will improve gradually so that she is able to increase her income and keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pig’s feed and more pigs to raise

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District
